text: 12floz bottle (BBD: 08.16.2017, $1.50) poured into a mug glass. It appears a very dark brown with a glistening light brown head. Bakers chocolate and molasses aromas are not strong, but noted. This beer is robust, yet not overbearing. Flavors consist of roasted and crystal/caramel malts that convey moderate amounts of dark chocolate and praline. Ill use the overused term solid to summarize the quality of this porter.

Very dark, not particularly heady but rich looking. Buttery, desserty aroma; milk chocolate, vanilla notes. Taste of brown sugar, quality milk chocolate, oat, toasted hops. Extremely smooth, milky quality. Excellent.

Dark with brown medium head if poured fairly fast. Nice rich nutty flavor, sharp with smooth finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: APR 19, 2017 Draft at Fado. Clear but nearly opaque dark brown garnet pour with off-white foam. Nice lace. Sweet dark roasty malts. Solid coffee notes. Cocoa nibs. Burnt nuts. Hints of dark berries. Full-bodied for a Porter. Enough hop bite for balance. Surprisingly well done.

Deep aroma of chocolate, coffee, red fruit, toffee, caramel, nuts, astringency by roasted malts and a kind of dust/metal hint due to the oxydation (Im talking about a 6.6% ABV bottle expired on december 2015). Clear dark brown color, long lasting tan head. Medium-high bitterness. Medium body, thin feel, soft carbonation, astringent and bitter finish. Its really a good one but Id suggest not to keep it in the cellar too long.
Botella de 33cl. Aromas a malta y chocolate. Cuerpo medio/alto, muy suave al paladar. Chocolate, café, Final seco y persistente. Un pedazo de cerveza. Para repetir

Dark brown color. Thin head. Very roasted malty chocolate cake and nutty nose. Medium full body. Low roastiness, ,chocolate dark fruit and modest hoppiness. Dry. Nice lingering roasted malt, chocolate and nutty finish.

Ah, ol roasty, still as toasty and burnt and drinkable as ever. Giant notes of espresso with dark chocolate undertones, leading to a bitter finish heavy on smoke and a dark cherry sweetness. A bit thin, even for a porter, yet the neverending char gives it an unmistakeable footprint. Not perfect but enjoyable as hell.

Bottle. BBE date Sept 2010; Drank Dec 2010 - Dark Brown, almost Black, in colour. Aroma of coffee and chocolate. Very Malty; very roasty malts, very coffee, very dark chocolate. Slightly smoky. Fruity; slightly sour/bitter note; berries?. Rather salty. Hoppy; some citrusy resinous hop bitterness. Sweet roast coffee and chocolate malty balanced by fruity hoppy bitterness. Dry hoppy bitter finish. Enjoyed this. Nice Porter! (2010-12)

Chocolate caramel sweetness licorice bit of spice.
Black creamy 1 finger taniñ head.
Sweet caramel opening, followed by chocolate bitterness, oily mouthfeel medium body medium carbonation.

Nice

Scents of malt and caramel with burnt pumpernickel. Pours a very dark brown with thin tan head and lots of lacing. Interesting balanced sour finish after a malty start. Mild carbonation and oily mouthfeel. Very well made porter.

Keg @El Cabanón, Avilés. 11-07-2016.
In short: dry bitter dark ale.
Pours black with nice light tan head. Long head retention, good lacing. Coffee, roasty, cacao nose. Medium body, average carbonation, oily texture. Taste is quite bitter, roasty, coffee,smooth, still some creamy palate. Quite dry aftertaste.
Giant dark chocolate aromas. Slightly affected by light dark brown light white head. Nice roasted bitters hit and then mellow into a coffee base. Medium body.
From bottle. Pours black with big, beige head. Chocolate, milkshake, cookies, coffee, smoke, ash, nuts. Medium carbonation, nice bitterness, sweet, sticky lips. Big porter with small alcohol content.

Color negro, opaco, con capa de espuma marrón de dos dedos de grosor (retención decente). Carbonatación imperceptible. Aroma meloso, dulce, algo licoroso, con notas de café. Sabor complejo, con prácticamente todo lo anterior, final medianamente amargo. Incluso en los primeros tragos me pareció percibir algo mínimamente ácido en boca. Extraña y rica.
0,33l bottle shared with wiosna @ Vihreä Haltiatar. Pours very dark brown with a low tan head. Aroma is roasted malts with some citrus. Flavor is roasted malts, citrus, coffee and hops. Good.

Quite superb taste for this percentage. Beside organic roasted malts, some tar and licorice can be detected. Averagely balanced with low/medium carbonation. Balanced, high quality product.

Many thanks for this beer to kevnic2008. Ciemna brazowa gesta barwa nieprzezroczysta. Ciemno zotka barwa sredniej pianki szybko opadajacej. Zapach silnie owocowo truflowy. W smaku na samym pczatku bardzo slodko, ale na szczescie smak przechodzi w palonosc i silna goryczke. Ciekawe i zlozone piwo w warstwie smakowej. Dlugi ciagnacy sie lepko-gozki finisz. plus za stylowa etykiete, a minus za brak info o zawartosci alkoholu

Bottle from a friend. Black color, beige head. Bitter taste with roasted malts, nuts, licorice, coffee, nuts and a bit of chocolate. Bitter finish with roasted malts, coffee, nuts, chocolate and licorice. Great porter.

A really nice, tasty and easy drinkable brew. Dangerously session able.Black color with a fine dense beige head. Good lacing. Ok intensity in the aroma. Medium + body and a soft smooth carbonation. A nice mellow sweetness. Mild coffee, chocolate, toffee, bready and mild roast.[Bottle from Systembolaget web order in Sweden]

Bottle. Pours black with thin tan top, minimum lacing. Surprisingly little in the way of scent, grassy perhaps, despite the peat black colour. But the taste is excellent and has a crispness and lightness on the palate that may convert some who are not generally drawn to the dark side.

Casi opaca, casi negra, de espuma beige, no muy abundante pero consistente. Marcado aroma tostado, a café y en menor medida chocolate. Rica en boca, compleja, ahumada al inicio, más dulce después, muy ligero toque ácido, y gran sabor con predominio ahora de chocolate y en menor medida café. Gran cuerpo, perfecta de gas y un final de amargor intenso que ensalza todo lo anterior. Gran Porter, que además es altamente bebible.

33 cl. Bottle @ Home.
Aroma: quite intense aromas of coffee, dark roasted and toasted malts, dark chocolate. Hints of alcohol but only after pouring. Very light hint of vanilla.
Appearance: very deep brown color, almost black. Too dark to tell if its hazy or clear, but seeing it when poured, i guess its pretty clear. Above average head thickness. Light brown head color with medium-to-high retention and some Brussels lacing.
Taste: light-to-medium sweetness, medium bitterness, very light sourness.
Palate: medium-to-full body, oily-to-creamy texture, low-to-flat carbonation, good silky mouthfeel. Quite long dry finish with tones of roasted malts, dark chocolate and coffee.
Overall: very good appearance and aromas. Excellent flavors of roasted and toasted malts, dark chocolate and coffee. Very good beer.

Bottle from the LCBO. Dark mahogany with a small tight khaki head that fades quickly to a sheet.Nose is roasted malt, coffee, dark chocolate, vanilla and a hint of smoke. Light+ sweet toffee start leads to a moderate dark chocolate and coffee bitterness. Mouth is medium and creamy with slightly soft carbonation and a lingering dry finish. Well put together and balanced porter.

8+/4-/8-/4+/16

33cl bottle. Black with medium head. Aroma is freshly brewed coffee beans, concentrated dry milk, toffee, black chocolate. All very intensive. Creamy and fluffy mouth feel. THe beer is well balanced with dominating flavour of black chocolate. Sweet on the beginning but it gets more and more bitter/earthy and roasted. Finish is earthy like cocoa beans. Nice stuff.
Smuttynose Robust Porter hits it right on the mark. Dark brown pour with a tight tan head. Aroma is chocolate. Taste is malty with some roasty and chocolate notes. Robust nails the style solid.

Bottle. Dark cola body, big chocolate head with average retention, some lacing. Aroma of roasted malts, coffee, cocoa, some raisins and a touch of molasses. Taste is on the dry side: roasted malts, well done toast, herbs and chocolate liquor. Good stuff.

Thanks to PaleAleRider for this one. Pours a dark brown colour with a creamy-foamy beige head with good retention and creamy lace. Roasted malt aromas with some nice sweetness to balance things, like cacao, vanilla also liquorice and a little grassy leaf. The taste starts off with coffee, steering into the burnt malt and finishing with the mild hops. Bitterness and dryness lingers. Quite a nice robust porter.

341ml bottle. Pours a huge frothy brownish head and has a dark brown appearance. Lots of sticky lacing remains. Good retention. Aromas of coffee, cocoa, chocolate and resin. Flavours are somewhat sweet at first but some bitterness and spice notes show up not too long after. Still with the coffee and chocolatey flavours but also some hints of dark roasted malt, toasty malts, resin and vanilla. Slight drying sensation on the palate.

Alkohol:  6,6% obj. 
 Kolor:  Ciemny brąz przechodzący w czarny. Nieprzejrzysty trunek. 
 Piana:  Wysoka, bujna, zbita jak białko.
Beżowa czapa równo ułożonych drobnych oczek. Bardzo długo pozostaje na górze. Opada powoli do grubej warstewki. Na ściankach mnóstwo malunków.
Silna strona piwa. 
 Zapach:  Ciemne owoce. Na pierwszy plan czarna porzeczka, śliwki, daktyle, rodzynki. Delikatna paloność, ciemne słody. Po pewnym czasie aromat zaczyna budować się od nowa i przybierać na złożoności. Pojawia się karmel i chlebowa nuta ciemnego pieczywa. Dopiero po ogrzaniu kawa i gorzka czekolada. Zdecydowana woń cukru trzcinowego.
Przyjemnie. 
 Smak:  Już po pierwszych łykach kremowe, gładziutkie i śliskie na języku. W smaku już potężna kawowość i płynna gorzka czekolada. W tle orzechy włoskie. Następnie karmel, trochę toffi i ciemne pieczywo.
Palony charakter miesza się z pieczonymi nutkami ciemnego słodu.
Smak zrównoważony, bogaty. Raz po raz balans przesuwa się ze strony wytrawnej na średnio-słodką.
Chmielowoś toczy ciągłą walkę z ciemnymi słodami. Średnie ciało, alkohol całkowicie ułożony. Goryczka średnia z kawowo-prażonym finiszem. Posmak palonego ziarna ciągle pozostaje w ustach. 
Bardzo dobry, jak nie doskonały wyznacznik stylu. 
 Wysycenie:  Niskie. 
 Podsumowanie:  

Zawsze chciałem spróbować tego piwa.
Browar specjalizuje się w świetnych porterach. Porter Bałtycki z Smuttynose należy do Top 3 najlepszych Baltic Porters na świecie.

To piwo natomiast jest z pewnością wyznacznikiem stylu Robust Porter.
Złożony smak i aromat tworzą ciemne słody, skórka chlebowa, toffi, karmel i oczywiście kawa z czekoladą.
Dość mocny, konkretny, bogaty trunek.
Silne nachmielenie i akcenty pieczone równoważy mocny (jak na styl) ale niewyczuwalny alkohol.
Fajna tekstura i kremowa, śliska gładkość na języku sprawiają, że pije się to piwo niezwykle przyjemnie.
Brawa dla Smuttynose - wyraźnie Portery im siedzą i potrafią warzyć genialne, stylowe "ciemniaki".
Bottle of 33cl, @ Cervezorama, Madrid. Very dark colour. Good coffee smell. Coffee and chocolate flavour.
Caña en el Lupulo 10..06..2016. Color negro con espuma beige. Aromas y sabores maltosos tostados algo secos con toques de regaliz negro. Cuerpo medio. Bastante buena.

33 cl bottle served in a white wine glass. Pours blackest of blacks, clean and bright. Moka-colored thick head. Intense aromas of coffe, chicory, leather, black chocolate and herbs. No liquorice present, though. Mouth feels soft, very creamy, elegant. Sheer but balanced bitterness. Very long-lasting finish. Very nice.

355ml bottle. Very dark brown almost black colour with a small tan head. Aroma of dark chocolate and roasted malts, hint of coffee. Taste of bitter dark chocolate and coffee, some hops in the finish I think, bit of smokiness as well. Smooth and drinkable.
Bottle "best by" date was August 15 (9 months ago as I write this), still tasted great though, hopefully can get hold of a fresher bottle soon would love to have it again.
dark red brown pour. Aroma creamy cocoa. pungent caramel rustic grains. Tastes coffee, clean caramel. deep char. dry and creamy palate. high earthy flavor. Great.

Dark brown to black in color with tan head... Velvety pour... Aroma of dark roasted malts, smoked malts, chocolate, some hints of coffee.. Light citrusy hops on finish, really pleasant porter

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dark brown with tan head and coffee aroma, with full body. Creamy with roasted malt taste, pleasant mildly bitter finish.

Un tripudio dei sapori che ti aspetti di sentire quando bevi una porter. Si va dellintensità del caffè che senti appena la assaggi, alla liquirizia al cioccolato mediamente persistente alla fine. Un corpo interessante che però mantiene la bevibilitá.

Pours a very dark brown with beige head. Aroma is dark roasted coffee, dark chocolate, dark malts, dark fruit, hint of vanilla. Taste is dark chocolate, dark coffee, dark fruit, licorice, caramel and vanilla. Decent carbonation. Very tasty and very drinkable.

I poured it from the bottle into a glass. It pours dark brown with a tan head and lacing. The label on the bottle is weird and almost made me not want to drink it. The aroma was coffee and chocolate. The taste was coffee, tobacco, smoke, and chocolate. The palate was smooth with the right amount of carbonation. This was a very nice porter.

Too many bottles over too many years. This is as straightforwardly pleasant as it gets -- a top-notch porter thats balanced, smooth, and chocolatey, and its also easy to find and inexpensive. What a beer!

Very smooth for a "robust" porter. Missing some of those smoke and anise flavours you hope for in a robust, but it is definitely decadent and smooth

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle from Secret Santa 15, thanks John. Black pour with a light tan head. Notes of tobacco, milky chocolate, ashy, tar, medium roast and some light licorice.

Bottle from Norwich Tap House. Very dark brown with slight hints of light finding their way through. Light brown ring of head. Milk chocolate in the aroma, complemented by a light floral note. Taste starts sweet, then the bitterness kicks in. Not mouth-puckering but very intense a full. Vanilla and spruce in the aftertaste. Pretty damn good.

Im traveling again on business and found this one in a fine bottle shop in Decatur, GA. Pours black with almost no head and no lacing. Aroma is chocolate and dark malts. Taste is the same with a nice sweetness. Medium mouthfeel.

Pours black with a medium sized tan head. Aromas of roasted dark chocolate, roasted malts, lacto, roasted nuts, slight vanilla. Taste is a bit chocolatey with slight bitterness and a wel balanced sweetness. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation. Very well balanced and just a great porter!
UPDATED: FEB 21, 2016 Thick and creamy head. Very mellow nose that's brought out more with a heavier pour. Well balanced and mild. Good beer overall but I prefer much more flavor in my porters.

6-pack from the LCBO. This seems to be the The Winter of The Porter, judging by the shelf space in the Toronto liqour stores (stouts in some odd retreat). Not that Im complaining. This porter is a pure beauty & serves as a high watermark for the style. Heres the thing with this brew: the pure joy of the drinkability. Its a smooth porter thats studded with flavour. Smooth creamy coffee, hints of wild berries, solid hop presence & a somewhat salty soy sauce finish in the back of throat. I usually avoid 6-packs of the same beer but Im glad I scooped this up. Recommended. Oh jeez look its my 900th rating. Lord help me. Lord help us all.
Tap at Ginger Man, New York. Colour is black with brownish white head. Aromas and flavours: Chocolate, coffee and roasted malts.

Tan head block size dark pour strong carbonation aromas liquorice rich chocolate dried fruit caramel coffee a creamy touch the flavours dark chocolate caramel rich coffee dried fruits liquorice creamy note mild bitter grass sweetness grain malts the finish a good porter just slightly watery only but still very good to drink best tastes malts richness hops abound sweetness creamy note lovely flavours

UPDATED: SEP 11, 2016 Bottle. Sweet, hoppy effervescent aroma. Well above average carbonation. Medium dark brown color. Delightful, well balanced beer. Slightly sweet, smooth predominantly hoppy flavor, with hints of chocolate and coffee. A refreshing respite from the current trend of mega-ABV porters and imperial ales that are simply too boozy to be imbibed as conventional beers. One of my new faves!

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines, Birmingham. Poured a dark brown with a thin tan head. The aroma is light creamy sweet malt. The flavour is moderate sweet with a liqourice malt, coffee, burnt toffee palate. Medium to full bodied with soft carbonation.
Bottle. Pour is black with a caramel frothy head, aroma is toffee, malty, sweet. Taste is malty, toffee, burnt notes, bitter. Very good

12 oz bottle into a pint glass from Ginos East. Black appearance with a small, light brown head. Aroma of milk chocolate, lactose, light roasted grain and light earthy hops. Similar flavor, creamy and moderately sweet with a light bitterness. Medium body with soft carbonation and a smooth finish. Good.
Faint vanilla and licorice aroma that is found within the coffee malt. Finish is smooth an velvety chocolate.
Good flavor, but really strong. A little too strong. Okay, its about as strong as the guy in the unitard on the label: like its been working out for years and taking selfies at the gym.
Single bottle from Julios. Pours out jet black with a frothy dark tan head. Very roasty aroma and flavors with decent hop balance. Dry bittersweet finish. Excellent porter.

UPDATED: MAY 18, 2016 26.11.2015, 12 oz bottle (bbd. 01.01.2016) shared with friends:
18.05.2016, 12 oz bottle (bbd. 01.01.2016) @ home:
Nice light brown fizzy-creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly sweet, caramel, dark malts, dark sugar, nuts, minerals, butterscotch. Taste is slightly harsh roasted, weeds, paper, sour caramel, grass, caramel malts, dark sugar, butterscotch. Medium bitterness, slightly harsh mineraly mouthfeel. Boring.
Mørk brun/svart farve med beige skum. Lukt av røstet malt, kaffe, sjokolade og krydder. Smak av røstet malt, kaffe, sjokolade og krydder. Lett bitter. Vinmonopolet.
Black colored porter with small but creamy head. Nice body with malty chocolate taste and some smoke aroma. Finish a bit thin for my taste. Decent porter but not astonishing.

Tasted this in Alfies Bar on 800 9th Avenue, New York on the 23rd September 2015. Keg dispense in a half pint glass. Black in colour with ruby highlights and a thin, creamy pale buff head. Strong sweetness of drinking chocolate powder coming through in the intense malty aroma. Thin oily mouthfeel and good lacing. Dark complex malts give a smooth delivery of liquorice, black coffee and roast grain flavours full in the mouth. Short dusty hop prickle adds a quick bitter aftertaste. Finish is smooth and malty with roast malt, liquorice, coffee beans and dark chocolate notes once again linger in the palate. This is a decent tasting Porter that belies the high gravity - beware!

355 ml. bottle sampled. Bottled on date is hard to read but looks like this one was bottled in 2013. Pours a very dark furniture brown, little to almost no mocha head. Nose is big on soy sauce, varnish, thinned out, ashes, herbal & more umami + soy sauce notes that I am not too crazy about. Taste is thin herbal, soy sauce, umami, leaves, thin & powdery with old herbs, feels thinned out, touch oxidized, more ashes, some port wine, leaves & licorice. Body much like taste is thinned out, ashy, powdery, faintly vinous almost (body & taste). Not too crazy about this one, age might play a part here but I feel like it just isnt really for me. Having this one in a better state would have been nicer.

UPDATED: JUL 22, 2016 Dark porter with nice baige head. Aroma of coffee, vanilla and some smoke I think. Taste of turkish coffee, out of ballance with bitterness which IMHO is too high. Good beer but thats all!
Thank you Sandra & Tom H.

Výčap Beergeek Bar. Čierna farba, krémová pena. Vôňa praených sladov, jemne karamelu a prezretých sliviek. Chuť v začiatkoch troku vodovejia. Neskôr suchosť kakao, čokoláda, praené slady. Príjemná dlhá dochuť.

Deep brown, lovely thick beige head. Aroma espresso, vanilla, molasses. Palate medium, higher carbonation. taste vanilla, coffee, sourish earthy spiciness which balances everything just right. Smoky and earthy finish.
Complex yet not overwhelming porter!

From tap at the BeerGeek bar, Prague. Dark brown almost black color with brown head. Roasted malty aroma, chocolate, coffee, licorice, dark dried fruits, light spicy, light smoked notes. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.
bottle. Dark brown colour, tan head. Aroma is dark chocolate and licorice. Taste of coffee, dark chocolate, hoppy bitterness
On tap, beer geek. Black colour with beige head. Aroma roasted, caramel, dark fruits. Taste is roasty, caramel, mollasses. Roasty aftertaste. Very good.
Tap at Beergeek Bar. Strong rich full malty beer, very nicely balanced, very smooth, making love to my tongue. Cocoa, chocolate and roasted flavours. Oh yeah, very good.

Bottle from Brisbane Brewing 311015. Always able to find a bottle of something new that I havent had at Brisbane Brewing. Ordered this while waiting for my slider board to come out - glad I did. Squid ink black, fluffy foam cushion, burnt aromas that reminded me of the sticky bits left in the pan after cooking a roast. Thick and creamy in the mouth.

a smut classic! .. . pours a deep brown black .. medium foam head, lacing of the stars .. . tar and burnt toast .. mouth is relatively full, mildly bitter finish .. a good porter .. . . that was regrettable. -me after things I do

Aroma of chocolate, coffee, nuts and licorice. Dark brown with a red tint, tan head. Medium sweet and medium bitter. Medium body with a average carbonation. Overall quite a nice porter, the carbonation level is a bit high for me, but still very enjoyable.

Bottle in the Head of Steam, Durham. Pours mahogany with a thin beige head. Light cocoa aroma. The taste is light spice with cocoa and coffee. Lingering dry bitter finish. Light bodied with quite high carbonation. Tasty.
Lovely! Thick and oily, loads of coffee, bitter dark chocolate, slight hoppy finish. Big porter for the ABV.
Strong coffee smell....super strong coffee taste...all coffee though, nothing deeper...bleh

Bottle. Pous a brownish to dark brown body with a nice tan head. Aroma is roasty with notes of smoke and tar. Hints of chocolate, malts and caramel. Lovely taste thats somewhat sweet at first, then goes roasty with a moderate bitterness. Hints of chocolate, coffee and caramel. Velvety smooth on the palate and soft to avg carbonation. This was awesome!

Aroma is full on classic porter. Soft roasted malts with a little coffee and nuts. Taste is roasted coffee, a soft note of tar with some liquorice. A very light carbonation together with the very well balanced ingredients makes this a top notch porter, maybe even too good? Its robust, and also a little bit anonymous.
Almost black with a thin tan head, some lacing. Smell is mostly chocolate. Taste is mostly espresso with a smoky finish. Balanced and smooth though a bit oily. An impressive Porter.
Leicht malziger Geschmack, Toffee schwach Kaffee, schwacher Abgang alles in allem kann es nicht ganz halten was es verspricht
0,33l Flasche. aroma karamell, milchzucker, cremig, schwarze Konsistenz. Für mich etwas zu flacher Geschmack.
From a bottle. Smells amazing, delicious roasted flavours, silky smooth and a bitter chocolate finish. Great stuff.
Black. Very thin oily tan head. Chocolate bomb. Semi-sweet. Lasting cocoa. Rich and almost chewy, in a great way. Delicious, and makes me want a bowl of ice cream. Thx johnnnniee!

355 ml bottle bought at Grebhan´s, Bremen. Pours out black and oily. Nearly no head. Choco and leather on the nose. Strong start with toffee, malt and hop in the second row. Some bitterness. Hints of citrus. Long aftertaste. Really nice one.

From 355 ml bottle. In the glass its a solid black with just a hint of brown highlight at the edge and a thick lasting tan head. I get aromas of chocolate, cherries, raisins, coffee nibs, walnuts and toffee. In the mouth, the first thing is a burst of fresh cherry, stewed fruit and dark chocolate. A strong coffee bitterness with a smoky overtone kicks in. Theres also a sharp fruity note similar to something from a good espresso. That leads to a chocolate and coffee finish with a lingering fruity aftertaste. Phenomenal.
Donker rood bruin bier met een goede beige schuim kraag. Ruikt koffie, chocolade, geroosterd, koek deeg. Smaakt koffie, geroosterd, chocolade, zacht.

Adquirida en Whole Foods, LES, New York. Tomo oscuro casi negro con espuma media amarronada. Aroma y sabor complejos. Predominan el chocolate, tabaco y café. Cerveza premium.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Light Brown head that stays there for a while, black body.
Bitter chocolate taste which is deeper than expected from a beer with this alcohol level.

12 oz. bottle picked up locally. Strange that I havent rated this yet (well, not really, just got caught in the backlog). Pours a dark brown color with a large frothy khaki head that diminishes into a thin layer with sporadic lacing. The aroma has roasted malts, some coffee, nice dark chocolate, and earth. The flavor is much of the same; roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, earth, and a subtle nutty character. Pretty much your basic robust porter, but well done, light medium bodied with a smooth mouthfeel.

L:
pours the darkest of brown with no light coming through and a medium to big,frothy,beige head
S:
coffee,chocolate,tobacco,faint dark fruits
T:
-Follows the nose plus mocha
F:
-medium carbonation
-medium body
O:
Good, but couldve popped a bit more

Bottle. Nearly black with a frothy tan head. Nice milk chocolate plate in the aroma, with a bit of smokiness and honey-tinged graham crackers. A little toasted marshmallow as well, plus a little prune. Flavor kicks off with dark fruits and bitterness, while dry burnt malt makes up the finish. A little bitter dark chocolate and smoke as well. Lingering roast. Smooth medium-light body; moderate prickly bitterness. Outstanding flavor and balance. Great example of the style.
Bottle at home. Black pour, thin tan head. Aroma of roasted malts, licorice, slightly spicy and some molasses. Flavor is quite bitter, roasted and with loads of licorice. Nice brew.

355ml bottle at a BYOB, no date or ABV details. Black, small brown head endures. Aroma is treacle, ash, a little raspberry and some bbq sauce. Also a little metallic. Body is medium, light carbonation, slightly foamy. Taste is twiggy, roast malts, very astringent and ashy, burnt wood, metallic, soft sweetness. Pretty nice stuff.

Bottle at home. Aroma of malt, roast, chocolate, cream, coffee, a hint of smoke, hoppy notes. Flavour is moderate sweet with a moderate to medium roasty and hoppy bitter finish. Body is medium to heavy. Wow, this is great Porter, theres a lot going on. Good balance between roast and hops.
Bottle from beermoth, manchester. Black color, brown head. Aroma has nicely roasty, coffee, licorice. Balanced, roasty, coffee, licorice.
Black in color with thin , beige head . Coffee , chocolate and nuts in aroma. Light sweetness in taste is mixed with roasted bitterness. Almost my ideal porter.
I might have drank too many porters lately - this one kinda misses the mark. Decent coffee flavor, but has a nasty sour aftertaste. I will have to try this again sometime.
From the very old notes, hence this is not a real rating, but more just a mark to myself that I have tried this at one point. Nice hoppy porter with chocolate and coffee notes.
Bottle bier huis ossett. Black tan head. Aroma is roast malts coffee taste same strong coffee some choc sweetness smokey bacon nice dark roasty ash bitter finish. Ok body. Very tasty good stuff

Chocolate and roasted coffee nose. Cola colored pour with tan head. Medium body, slippery mouthfeel, soft carbonation, long finish. Chocolate, coffee, subtle earthy nuttiness and sweet red fruits. Good beer.
Copper pour with an off white head. On tap at Broadway Brewhouse in Nashville. Medium hops, heavy malts, toffee finish.

A very dark reddish brown coloured beer with a thick latte coloured head. A light roasted malt aroma, coffee, chocolate and nutty, plus a hint of ripe red fruits. Medium dry and fizzy mouthfeel. A bitter sweet roasted malt taste, burnt sugar, strong espresso coffee, dark chocolate, and nutty, then the sweeter ripened red fruit flavour comes through towards the end. The finish is bitter sweet and lengthy. Bottle from Beers of Europe.
Pours a deep dark brown from a bottle with a khaki head. Aroma of coffee, a little chocolate, flavor similar with some burnt notes. Good beer.

Bottle from Signal Variety, Plaistow NH. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate nibs and hint of coffee. Appearance is opaque black with minimal light brown head, with fair foamy lacing. Taste is balanced moderately sweet chocolatey flavor with moderately bitter coffee flavor. Palate is medium bodied with medium, slightly slick texture, soft carbonation and nice, long finish like chocolate covered espresso beans. Overall, really nice all around. Nitpicking, head could be larger, texture a little thicker, but those things only separate it from where it is--very, very, good, with the only place left to go--world class.

Bottle from Rudat, Dortmund.  The beer starts malty intense. Dark red fruit, plums, malt with a nice subtle but intense sweetness. Viscous, bitter-sweet, a bit too burned in the end, still easy to drink, roasted burned malt with plums and quite much hop bitterness in the end. Very interesting but nice!
Deep brown with small head. Very solid porter. Huge roasted malt. Chocolate and mild hop bitterness. Textbook example of the style.

On tap at beertemple, amsterdam. Body is pitch black, head is medium, brownish, creamy, mostly diminishing, excellent lacing. Nose is roasty, flavor is coffee, roasted malt, toast, mocha, toffee. Light sweet, heavy roasty bitter. Finish is long lasting roasty bitter. Full body, dry sticky texture, average carbonation. Quite easy dessert beer, great taste, wonderful beer.

Noire petit collet persistant. 
Aromes café moka.
Un petit regal une fois en bouche. Les saveurs torréfiés enveloppent le palais.
La longueur est toutefois un peu courte mais cela reste u e grande bière.
Beautiful ebony pour with minimal beige head. Aroma of roasted malts. Taste is roasted malts with hints of coffee and chocolate. Hoppy finish. Very good porter.

Originally rated on 9/28/14. "Pours a dark brown/ black body with a foamy dark khaki head that settles to a film on top of the beer. Medium thick lace rings are left behind. Smell is of dark and burnt roasted malts, cocoa, and touch of soy sauce . Taste is much the same with cocoa, bitter coffee, and citrus hints on the finish. There is a nice balance between the roasted coffee and chocolate malts and hop bitterness. Crisp mouthfeel yet smooth going down. Overall, a nice robust and tasty porter indeeed.

Bottle to pint glass. Dark brown pour with a finger or so of tan head. Mostly coffee grounds and cacao nibs in the aroma - a little bourbon in the back. Taste is similarly coffee-forward with a little prune coming in after and a boozy kick at the end.

On tap at the Beertemple. Dark with a small beige head. Aroma of coffee, roasted malts, hint of alcohol and something sour. Taste bitter sweet roasted, coffee, roasted malts, hint of sour, bitter roasted coffee aftertaste. Bit thin maybe, but not bad, especially considering the low abv.

Bottle into fancy stout glass. Black w large thick head on hard pour. Minimal aroma. Creamy robust stout. Hints of chocolate. Good solid porter. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Very dark brown, almost black. Medium, long-lasting beige head. Strong aroma of coffee and dark chocolate. Moderate carbonation and creamy mouthfeel. Flavor is coffee and dark chocolate with a little bitterness. Nice porter.

Aroma: intense toasted malts, cacao, filter coffee. Appearance: black, medium, creamy, beige head. Taste: light bitter. Palate: very intense, dry, toasted malts, long, dry, bitter finish. Overall: excellent Porter, nice toasted malts in aroma and palate, not too heavy, yet quite complex. Bottle at Draft House Charlotte Street, Fitzrovia.
Draft @ beer temple. Black pour, white head. Aroma of dry coffee and cacao. Taste is very dry as well, with lots of roasted malt and coffee. Good porter.

Smoked ham like arkma, also coffee, oak and caramel.nicw dark colour with a lightbrown head. Really deep malty aroma. Lots of dry roasted bread, some hint of rasins, coffee and a little kick of hops. Well balanced, full body. Smoked bitter, and a bit sour (rasins) aftertaste.

@BeerTemple, Amsterdam, 30/5/2015 - Zwart met bruine kraag. Aroma van chocolade, volmoutig, vanille Smaken van koffie, vol en romig, chocolade, matig zoet, matig bitter, wat droog en bovendien erg lekker....
Virtually black with a fudgy beige head. Toffee, coffee and chocolate. Medium body, flavour as the aroma, quite a roasted bitterness.
Not my favorite porter, but still a very enjoyable beer. Good aroma. Tasty beer. Pleasing mouthfeel.
bottle. Deep brown with small head. Very solid porter. Huge roasted malt. Chocolate and mild hop bitterness. Textbook example of the style.
Pours dark brown with a tan head. Aromas of coffee and chocolate with a little smokiness. Taste the same as aroma. Medium mouth feel. Very nice porter.
Bottle from Bruisin? Ales. Rich roasty and chocolate aroma. Rich roasty taste, with medium bitterness.

Bottle at home split with Sarah. Dark mahogany brown coloured pour with reddy hues and a lasting light tan head. Aroma is sweet woody caramel, vanilla, with dark choc and woody roast with a hint of smoke. Flavour is composed of dark malts, robust roast and dark choc bitterness, little chalky mineral, charcoal. Palate is medium bodies, with spritzy carbonation, chalky water profile. Good beer but lacks a bit of depth.

On tap at Irreale. Chocolate and coffee aroma. Dark chocolate flavor with peppery notes, nice tobacco background. When warmed, it has some new aroma notes, nutty hints and tobacco. Perhaps a little bit high acidity from the roasted malts. Good beer.
Bottle at home, bought in Berlin, 2nd May 15. Loads of smokey chocolate, coffee, strong backbone. Really nice porter

(Smuttynose Robust Porter) Bottle 355 ml at home, served into a snifter, ABV 6.6%
Black coloured bosy with a full finger of thick, light brown head on top, with good retention, leaving light lacing behind.
Aroma of roasted malts, chocolate.
Great taste, lots of roasted and burnt malts, dark chocolate, coal, light acidity somewhere in between, eventually finishing with a nice roasty bitterness.
Medium thin body, good carbonation.
Pretty good.
Bottle from alesela. Pours dark brown, thin tan head. Aromas of chocolate, light coffee. Taste is caramel, toffee. Light sweet finish.

Roasted malty aroma and taste, caramel, coffee, nice burnt notes, very good.

---Sent via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Its robust. Solid taste of chocolate and roast coffee in the malt. A little bitterness in the hops but not too much. Medium bodied and quite drinkable. A little smokey.

Brown creamy head. Dark brown colour. Aroma is malty with light fruity (cherries), earthy, dark chocolate and coffee notes. Flavor is malty too with chocolate, licorice and light banana tones, ending in a dry dark, chocolatey finish. Medium bodied.
330ml bottle. Aroma is malty, citrus-ish. Appearance is black with a brown-ish head. Taste is bittersweet. Almost no carbonation. Dry. Very nice.

Draft sample at the Cherry Blossom Beer & Wine fest a week ago, opaque dark brown color with light tan head. Aroma notes of roasted malt, dark coffee, chocolate and some smoke. Taste adds cocoa, espresso, ash and some herbal hops. Light-medium body, low-moderate carbonation, dry, soft with roast finish. Not many dark styles here so this is very tasty and appreciated.

350ml bottle. Opaque, darkest brown colour with average to huge, frothy to creamy, fairly lasting, moderately lacing, beige head. Dusty, chocolately, dark malty aroma, hints of cocoa, unroasted coffee beans. Taste is initially dry, chocolately, roasty, spicy dark malty with subtle sweetness, slightly dusty, later with more and more resinous hoppy influences; lasting, bitter, roasty, spicy finish, full body, super soft palate. Paradigmatic.
No, so robust wie es angekündigt wird, ist es nicht, aber dennoch schön knackig mit einer leichten Schärfe im Hintergrund. Etwas Stroh, Röstmalze, etwas Kaffee und ein Schuss Hopfen. Gute Sache.

Bottle from Rudat in Dortmund. The beer has got a deep black/ dark brown colour with a steady, creamy head and smooth body. Aroma of roast, malt and chocolate. Taste of roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, dark bread and toasted biscuits. Smooth to drink, very quaffable. Enjoyed it.

Bottle. Nose is sweet coffee, malt, toast, chocolate. Taste is leading bitterness, with a gentle undercurrent of chocolate, coffee, and smoke. Notes of ash, vanilla and hazelnut emerge on subsequent tastes. Mouthfeel is good. 

A note perfect porter.
A fine porter. Non-sweet. Quite roasty. Hops are plentiful, which makes this interesting. recommended!!

Dark cola-colored beer with a thin beige head that disappears quickly. Rich roasted nose of dark coffee, molasses, and semi-sweet chocolate. Flavor is equally rich with the bitter coffee hitting immediately followed up by some sweetness, including vanilla, toffee, and prunes. This is then finished with a mild bitterness with underlying roasted grain. Good beer.
Bottle. Pours mahogany with tan head and lacing. Nose is mild aroma of chocolate and roast. Taste is refreshing. Chocolate and some coffee. Good.

On tap at Brunzies. Nice roasted malted smoky nose, but a bit of fetid gas-earthy smell that was a bit off-putting. Dark brown-black opaque with thin tan head. Medium body with medium carbonation. Nice roasted malt, robust tang, molasses, smoke, chocolate. Big hop bitter with light nutty astringent character, light bitter lactose after.

Dark choc, earthy hops, and roasted barley dominate the aroma, which also has some brown sugar, coffee, pine, and a whisper of licorice. The mouthfeel is medium, with a medium body and sustained effervescence. The taste is bitter, with very minor sugary sweetness that is otherwise dominated by ash, coffee, dark chocolate, and earthy flavors, which drag on to a slow, dry, roasty finish. Great beerjust what you expect it to be.

In bottiglia da 33cl. Colore nero, schiuma beige fine e poco persistente. Aroma di fondo di caffè, caffè, cioccolato fondente, leggero tocco erbaceo finale. al palato corpo medio, alcool ben nascosto. Sentori di fondo di caffè, caffè, cioccolato e liquirizia nel finale.

Bottle 33cl / Botella 33cl.
@ Cerveceria Seny.
A: Black / Negro.
T/S: Roasted malt, chocolate, coffe / Malta tostada, chocolate, cafe

Pours almost black with foaming beige head
Aroma is chocolate with grain roasty, 
Taste is bitter chocolate with malt and a dry bitter finish
nice beer

Bottle from Half Time Beverage, New York. Pours a deep dark brown with a tan head, slowly dissipating. Aroma of slightly bitter chocolate, roasted coffee and nut. Quite high level of bitterness to taste and finish, medium body, slick texture, with soft carbonation.

Bottle from sheffield tap. Black with nice tan head. Milky on the nose, it has an ashy and very roasty aroma to start, finishing with hints of chocolate and espresso. Taste is dry and bitter. Medium carb and medium/full body. Good stuff.

Dark-chocolate-to-cola brown with 2mm light-brown head that fades moderate-to-quick. Aroma is dark, chewy caramel and candied pine sap. Light coffee. hint of scone. Body is medium-light, somewhat oily, moderate-coarseness carbonation, very creamy with medium-light burn. Flavor is toasted bread, touch of rye and pumpernickel, slight resin, pine, and grapefruit peel. Overall, an exceptional porter, amazing creamy body and dark forest notes. Yumm!!!

Pours pitch black with a moderate velvet brown head. Aroma is rich chocolate and coffee with roasted malts. Taste is just an awesome porter. Right to style, nothing special, nothing gimmicky, just a damn good porter.

12 ounce bottle into pint glass, best before 6/8/2015. Pours fairly pitch black color with a 2 finger dense and rocky tan head with great retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lingers. Nice dense soapy lacing clings around- the glass, with a moderate amount of streaming carbonation retaining the head. Aromas of dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, caramel, toast, toffee, dark bread, light nuttiness, light smoke/char, light herbal, and roasted earthiness. Very nice aromas with good balance and complexity of dark/roasted/bready malt and light earthy hop notes; with good strength. Taste of big dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, caramel, toast, toffee, dark bread, light nuttiness, light smoke/char, light herbal, and roasted earthiness. Fair amount of roast and herbal hop bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, caramel, toast, toffee, dark bread, light nuttiness, light smoke/char, and roasted earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Fantastic complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/roast/bready malt and light earthy hop flavors; with a great roasted bitterness/sweetness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth, creamy, and lightly slick/chalky mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is very well hidden with minimal warming present after the finish. Overall this is an awesome porter style. All around great robustness, complexity, and balance of dark/roast/bready malt and light earthy hop flavors; and very smooth to drink for the abv. A highly enjoyable offering.
Starchy on the palate, light body, malty, grains, coffee, vanilla, very easy drinking without being smooth. I love porters but not a fan of this one

Cervesa amb molt aroma i gust a cafè i a xocolata, lescuma és densa i persistent.
Cerveza con mucho aroma y sabor a café y a chocolate, la espuma es densa y persistente.

12 oz bottle. Poured a dark brown with a thin khaki head and minimal lacing. Taste of dark chocolate, coffee and a profound herbal hop finish. Medium carbonation, medium body. Overall, a little too hoppy for my palate. I prefer my porters to be more malt dominant. Cheers

Dark, thick, as a Porter should be. More on the Stout side than Porter. Go for it!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Black pour, creamy toffee head. Nose is coffee, hint cream. Bittersweet. Middle is dark patent malt, molasses, and coco. Finish dries to a flavorful bitterness. Yum.
Overall: Hoppy, god bite.Note: On-tap at De Klomp. Reviewed 2015-01-03.

12 oz. bottle served in a tumbler- poured a non transparent black when held to a light source (not quite midnight black during a severe thunderstorm, but a solid non changed motor oil after 7500 miles), somewhat lively medium carbonation, thin wisps of a tan head that just coated the liquid surface and sat very still in the vessel, some lacing upon the vessel. Aroma of coffee, bakers chocolate, and a roasted malt. Hits the mouth with a very wide body, malt tastes like it put into the roaster by the new guy and forgotten about until the end of the shift- which works in this case, some smoke in the middle, finish coats the palate and lasts, just a touch of oil on the backend. Why did I wait so long to try this? And why did I only buy one?!?!

Color negro con reflejos rubí y espuma beige duradera. Aromas intensos de chocolate, café, toffe y malta. Cuerpo medio, débil duklzor inicial pronto sobre pasado por el final de amargor medio, tostado y achocolatado.
On tap at Biercab. Black colour with white head. Roasted, coffee aroma. Roasted, coffee, dark chocolate taste, slightly sweet. Medium body.
Interesting bottle. A good porter. Nice a smooth, sweet, chocolate, malts, caramel. Not too roasted. Rich but I didnt detect too much coffee.

From a bottle with dessert at Rezaz, Biltmore Village. Delicious. One of the best porters out there. Cold glass it was poured into was unfortunate, but beer shone above that. Dark, opaque pour with tan head. Decent lacing. Dark beer deliciousness all present and accounted for- coffee, chocolate, roasted malt, nuttiness, earthy and a hint of smoke. Robust is accurate- nice smooth, full mouthfeel and weight. Great balance- hops at the end keep the sweetness in check. Brewing like they mean it up in NH. Delicious.

33cl bottle from Grand Cru, Rimini. It pours a dark brown color with a thin tan head. Aroma is nice roasted malt and espresso, light caramel. Taste is medium sweet and medium roasty and bitter, with notes of roasted malts, dark chocolate, espresso, earth. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, very nice

Deep brown, almost black, body with dark tan head. Caramel nose with a metallic copper aspect and pleasant roasted malts. Big coffee flavor; very earthy and nutty. Some subtle floral hoppy notes progressively developed. Smooth tasty porter.

This is a nice full porter without edging into sugary sweet malt, keeps a good balance and has a perfect hop counterpoint. Brown pour with (as I said) rich detailed and hoppy-bready aroma. Taste is full and complex with a good palate. Im getting the toffee and hints of demerera-molasses flavors, some dark fruit, mild coffee and chocolate but not too roasty, not really a sour componenent but the dryness is enough, herbal hops tucked in there, really tasty. Worth stocking up on a few.
UPDATED: AUG 22, 2015 Roasted malt nose, dark opaque black with brown head. Strong malt up front with lingering coffe and some hops to finish. Delightful stuff. One of my favorites of the style.
Thick and rich roasted malt aroma, black with a thick dense brown head. Medium to full bodied, very creamy, big flavour, lots of roasted malt, a prickle of hop, long aftertaste. Nice.
So geht Porter. Kakao en masse, Bitterschokolade, dunkle früchte. Kaffeebitterkeit im Geschmack, Schokolade, Cremigkeit, recht stark karbonisiert.
Roasted malts evident in aroma, with hops, rich and smooth flavor. The bitterness is spot on for an American Robust Porter.
Very dark with a great big frothy tan head. Aroma of roast, coffee, chocolate. Tastes roasty and moderately bitter and chocolatey. Pretty full, creamy body. Very nice.

6er from the lcbo. Outstanding roasty aroma, slight amounts of coffee, just alot of dark, slightly sweet roast. The flavour was a really great amount if piney hops, with alot more roast, with toiches of soy, and coffee. Outstanding porter.

Bottle. Pours deep mahogany, small brown head, dissipates quickly, some lacing. Aroma is chocolate, roasty, a touch of anise, dark sugars. Flavor is medium sweet, light bitter, roasty and dark chocolate notes. Light acidity. Medium body. Quite solid for a basic porter.

341ml bottle 
6.6% ABV (as marked on bottle) 
Milton LCBO Outlet #1 (Milton, Ontario, Canada)
November 25, 2014 
The beer pours a translucent dark brown (when held to bright light) with a creamy tan coloured cap. The aroma is roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, and vanilla. The aroma is medium bodied with above average carbonation. The flavour is dark malt, coffee, and weak chocolate.

Pours a nice pitch black color with a nice head. Aroma you pick up the malt aroma, with a slight hint of chocolate. Not too heavy on the palate, malts with subtle hop, pick up a little more of the chocolate. Very solid, true to form porter.

Bottle (trade with non Rate Beer member); pours dark brown with a mocha colored head; chocolate aroma with some roast coffee and malt notes; taste is bittersweet chocolate with some malt and coffee; finish light bitter; very good porter
6er LCBO purchase. deep brown, tan head. solid session style porter, to light to be robust. enjoyable but not the best american porter ive had.

12fl oz bottle from the Lcbo
pours a pitch black frothy head
nice roasted malt and chocolate aroma lots of chocolate
medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, creamy, 
Nice

0,355 l bottle (BB 27/11/2014). Pitch black with a thick, creamy, stable, light brown head. Heavy aroma of roasted malt, dark chocolate, coffee and cocoa powder. Sweetish-bitter, coffee-like taste with dark chocolate and hints of prunes and raisins. Full body, creamy mouthfeel, long, slightly bitter finish. Great porter which leaves nothing to be desired.

355ml bottle. Pours a near black/caramel with a two finger, tan head. Aroma has big, slightly sweet, notes of roasted malts, chocolate, and some mild hops. Taste is rich but balanced. Dark chocolate and cocoa with some hop bitterness, and a smooth finish. Medium body and carbonation. Clean in the mouth with a slightly creamy texture and a mildly dry finish. Overall very tasty. Big dark chocolate and cocoa powder. Not as sweet as say the Founders Porter but still tasty.
Smoky malt metallic aroma. Dark hair, tan somewhat fizzy head. Taste of smoked malt and coffee with chocolate. Somewhat bitter.
Bottle from LCBO, BB 03-11-2015. Roasted dark chocolate. Really smooth and balanced. Mild bitter finish. Let it warm up. Robust yet sessionable..
single bottle from LCBO. Black with average head. Toffee/ espresso aroma dominated aroma. On the palate it is quite burnt toast like and fairly aggressive. Very tasty.
355ml bottle, pours black wih an off white head, dark, roasty malts, hazelnut and some smokiness over citrussy hop with a long bitter and dry chalky finish. Hoppy for a porter but balanced nicely.

12 ounce bottle pours a dark darker black color with a nice foamy tan head that dissipates slowly. Aromas of coffee and toffee. Coffee and dark chocolate flavoring high level of carbonation. Medium bodied. A bit of a harsh aftertaste.

Smells delicious, notes of dark roasted malt, metallic, soy, tarry notes. Completely black with a rapidly fading dark brown head. Delicious beer, upfront more metallic and roasty notes in the taste, finishes with leafy hops and a building bitterness. Not too sweet. Medium bodied and average carbonation. Tons of flavor for the ABV and those that I personally like -- a great Porter.

UPDATED: DEC 31, 2014 Black brew with a small head that didnt hold for long. Smells of roasted malts with some hints at coffee. Taste is roasted and chocolate with the hints at coffee but also a spicy hop bite to it. Not really a fan of porters with so much hops. The hops make me think that someone poured an IPA in with my good porter just to mess with me.    ** That was my review Nov 14, 2014 **  After drinking a few other porters tonight I came to a bottle that had been pushed to the back of my fridge.  Yes I am still saying too hopped but not as bad as I had stated in Nov, so I am raising my scores for how I feel about it today.
Dark pour mocha head. Aromas of coffee and dark chocolate. Good flavor and long finish.
Pours very dark with a finger of tan head. Aroma of dark chocolate and roasted grain. Taste is bitter chocolate, bitter coffee. Delicioso.

355 ml bottle from LCBO. Pours a very dark brown with reddish hints and moderate-sized light tan head. Aroma is roasty with cocoa, coffee and some sweetish toffee. Flavour has a pleasant roastiness with good helping of cocoa and some coffee, some earthy hops and hints of sweet toffee. Slick mouthfeel. Quite good.
Pours a dark brown almost black color with khaki colored head. Chocolate, roasted malt, and some spice on the nose; follows onto the palate. Finishes with raw unsweetened cocoa note.

Growler fill from Kreston's in Middletown. Pours dark brown with a light brown foam. Nose is slightly sweet with hints of chocolate. Hoppy dryness up front. Finishes crisp with a roasted malt flavor. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours black with a creamy, tan head that stays long. Nose is roasted malt and grain. Bit of a barnyard hint there. Taste is on the bitter side. Full body. Lively carbonation. Decent porter, although not a favorite for the style.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

September 25, 2014. Bottle at SBWF. Pours black with a creamy brown head. Aroma is coffee, chocolate, light dried fruit, and ash. Taste is dark bitter chocolate, medium sweet biscuity. Finish is medium dry bitter roasted coffee notes. Light to medium bodied, average carbonation.

Delicious porter. Aroma was alright. Notes of roasted coffee but not very full. Pour was a nice deep dark brown with a tan ring for a head. Taste was nice especially for the low ABV. Roasted coffee beans with a mild dark chocolate finish. Light hoppiness and a nice malty finish. Tastes like an 8% beer. Nicely done.
user_location: Moon Twp, suburb of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA

text: 12 oz bottle. Smell the coffee, good aroma. Black with little head. Id call this a medium body drink finish is nice a little bitter.
Sample at SBWF 2014. Malty smell with caramel and chocolate. Similar taste. Well made.

12 oz. bottle. It pours a dark brown color with a tan head. The aroma has dark chocolate and bread with some plum, raisin, mild coffee and licorice. The flavor is substantial with rich bread, roasted malt, earthy hops, some dark chocolate and a nice smoky, roasted finish. Medium bodied and a decent amount of dark malt acidity gives it a nice bite. Very enjoyable.

shared bottle by a friend. poured a dark brown colour with a nice tanned head. lots of sweet chocolate forward. roasted malts, caramel, cacao, some coffee. very full bodied mouthfeel for its low abv. pretty suprised

Spongy, decent head with a froth brown head, pours a dark brown color.

Has aromas of toffee, coffee, creamy chocolate, roasted malts, hints of raisins and salt - very inviting, also very sweet smelling.

Begins with wooden malts among a toffee sweetness with hints of cane sugar, which directly turns more present, accompanied by molasse. Burned malts settle the balance in this one, smoothing the way for a spicy coffee bitterness, wrapped up by soft cream, creating a smooth mouthfeel. High carbonation adds complexity and piercing force to the coffee, which punshes in a pleasant way through the slick sweetness, creating a convincing, diversified complexity. Finishes very smooth, sweetness turns coca-cola like for a split-second, soon getting detained by rich, roasted, unsweetened chocolate and coffee, along with wooden hints.

Bottle. From a trade around 07. Best before: feb 11. Black, beige head. Chocolate aroma with notes of prunes and dark, toasted malt. Very nice and promising aroma. A palate with some carbonation fills the mouth immediately and spreads sweet chocolate notes, strong coffee flavours and an intense finishing malty bitterness, which stays on the tongue for a while. Lovely beer.

Excellent beer for Autumn. Chocolate, malty hues and notes. Thick and rich head. It has a flavor of roasted coffee with a smooth wash down. Not as bitter as the color suggests but extremely drinkable.

An excellent porter! Dark brown to almost black with tan head of fine bubbles. The lacing continues down the glass very thin but is there all the way to the end---even when interrupted drinking takes 25 minutes or more!
The aromas seemed a little weak for such a flavorful beer. Some smell of smoke and coffee malt; tastes of coffee and very slight bitter chocolate, some soy. Well done porter that is so easy to drink and maintains good flavor even as it warms to room temp. Has a slight bitter finish, not too dry a little more fig or raisin would have been perfect but still is an excellent brew!

Bottle. Pours an almost-opaque brown-black with very faint garnet highlights. Head is brown, large-grained, and lacy; it has good duration. Nose is smoked latte, baking chocolate, and figs. Intensely roasty on the front of the tongue, with coffee, soy, savory, rosemary, unsweetened chocolate, and dried plum notes; the weight is correct for the style. This isnt an imperial porter, its just an excellent regular porter. Finish is long, smoky, dry, and bitter. Very well made.
Dunkel rötlichbraunes Bier mit ordentlicher bräunlichen Schaumkrone. Geruch röstmalzig, schokoladig, Kaffee. Geschmack röstmalzig, Schokolade, Kaffe, reife Früchte.

12oz bottle, from Mondial de la Bière, Mulhouse shop. Gorgeously velvet, deep brown pour with creamy thick tan head. Nose radiates freshness all over: blackened malts, freshly ground arabica beans, vanilla and red berry, given an extra peppery zing by garden herbs. Taste caters with an extraordinary subtlety and balance to the full spectrum of dry & roasted: more dark chocolate, given a luxurious edge countered by citrussy hops, freshly brewed coffee with an infusion of bayleaf and black pepper corn. Astringent, perfectly dry palate with medium mouthfeel. Lingering finish summmoning all aromas and tastes for a final victory lap on the smacking lips. A fine blackened specimen of oxymorontic NH Yankee subtlety and balance, covering more iconic bases of US brewing than many an amped & barreled ImpStout, and at half the abv ransom.

UPDATED: AUG 13, 2015 Typical robust porter made from five malt types and Cascade hops. Tasted years ago at a Vilvordia Bierproeffestival and now again at GBBF, thanks to BeerTemples Ster for sharing!  Beige, creamy, lacing head, dark chocolate brown colour bordering on black. Aroma of black coffee, raisins, chocolate, dried plums, toffee, black pepper... Full malty taste, thick with a dark fruitiness and coffee- and chocolate-like dark maltiness, long hop bitter finish, very dry, tonic water-like, very satisfying but perhaps lacking a bit of body for a robust porter.

0,355 l bottle BB 27. Nov 2014 
chocolate, roasty, herbs, earthy, brown, hazy, rocky head, brown foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, full body, creamy, thick feel, soft carbonation, long finish,

Pours dark mahogany brown with a large brown head. Smells chocolatey. Taste is chocolate and roast. Medium-bodied with a smooth texture and soft mouth-carbonation, Smuttynose Robust Porter finishes with a subtle lingering roast bitterness.

Pours black with a small head leaving some lacing. Aroma: dark malts, chocolate and some lactose aromas typical for milk stouts. Taste: chocolate, roasted malts, well balanced. A solid porter, however, nothing too spectacular.

355 ml bottle. Pours a reddish black with a resilient white head. Aroma is fruity, chocolatey, ashy and tobacco-y. Flavor is dark berries, coffee and chocolatey notes. Very dry. A surprising level of tartness, with the obvious coffee bitterness. Some menthol. Lingering tobacco flavor. Medium body, strong carbonation. Good porter!
One of my new favorite porters. Pours black with tan head. Aromas are beautiful roasted nuts and coffee. More nuttiness in the flavors as well as coffee and chocolate notes. Yum.

Appearance is a slightly transparent light brown/deep deep tan. Pours a nice tan/creamy head. In the nose, I get roasty coffee with a bit of chocolate. The taste is a very nice, if slightly thin robust porter. Chocolate and coffee notes are there. Has a very light finish...not a dry one, which I personally dont like in this style. Leaves a lingering bitter coffee taste, not unpleasant though. A really nice beer overall.

11th July 2014 on-tap at the Crow Bar, Orange County. Very dark body, might even be black, difficult to tell in the downstairs of the Crow Bar as it is fairly dark. Deeply tanned head. Coffee and chocolate aromas and taste dominate the brew a really malty roasted feel to it. Semi-sweet overall and a decent beer to finish the night on, as was the case this evening.

On tap 5 oz. sample at Judges' Bench in Ellicott City, MD. 

Opaque, near black with a creamy tan head and excellent lacing. 

Aroma of smoky roasted malt, caramel and roasted coffee. 

Taste of roasted coffee, dark chocolate, roasted malt, wood duff and burnt sugar. 

Full/medium body and low/medium carbonization.

Pours a deep black/brown with a medium creamy beige head. Aroma is coffee, smoked wood chips, chocolate, grassy hop. Flavor is bitter hop, roasted / smoked malts, some dark fruit & licorice. Finish is lightly bitter, definite ash in the taste. Very solid all around, med body / avg carbo.

12oz into a pint, pours a thick black and burnt brown shade of darkness, taste is midly hoppy, carbination is delicate and direct, malt presence is a main stay as it fortifies the brew in the porter sense, dry to the tounge, coca, old coffee, dark fruits, a full bodied porter here with a backbone to support it. Not really a porter fan, so one is enough, but a good one it was. Sampled from a variety pack Julio brought over.
Pours black, mocha head. Aroma of coffee. Taste is chocolate, caramel, espresso, very complex, great finish and mouth feel. Just the right carbonation. Love it!

Petite bouteille trouvée à Richford. Meilleure avant le 28 octobre 2014. Une robe presque noire. Une tête qui sévapore rapidement. Une jolie dentelle. Mon nez aime beaucoup les arômes de pain brûlé, de torréfaction, de sirop dérable et de chocolat. Au goût, mes papilles restent bien accrochées aux délicieux malts et houblons: jadore la pointe citronnée derrière les céréales bien norcies. En bouche, japprécie sa structure crémeuse et la vivacité de son corps. En finale, je me régale de cette longue tirade damertume offerte par les cultivars et les grains rôtis. Quel excellent porter!

Black colour, moderate tan head. Moderate roasty aroma, notes of coffee, hints of dark chocolate. Decent roasty and woody flavour, notes of coffee and unsweetened liquorice, hints of burnt sugar and dark bitter chocolate.
Nice example of a porter. Flavors of malt, coffee and a hint of smoke. Very nice.

Black. Nice frothy creamy medium brown head. Aromas is great. Chocolatey and a really welcoming light coffee roastiness. Higher end of light body. Smooth and creamy. Flavor is cocoa and light coffee. Pretty Dry. Light earthy like bitterness. Great balance for my tastes. Tasty with great drinkability, if a little thin. More character and complexity than the typical porter. Prefect roastiness throughout.
roasty, sweet, vanilla, chocolate, a little cream. Surprisingly light and smooth, fairly refreshing. not heavy at all.

DATE REVIEWED: May 9, 2014... GLASSWARE: Howards Pub pint... OCCASION: NFL draft, day two--and the Manziel rush dissipates with Gordons suspension... APPEARANCE: thick two-finger brown head sits atop a jet black body--yup, its a porter! thick, smeared lacing... AROMA: rich, toasted malty tone; toffee is present; hops are punchy but brief... PALATE: creamy, vibrantly active at the throat; a softened, stout-like profile that endears and demands another sip...TASTE: sweetly puckering malts, pleasant and easy drinking; toffee and lactic flavors predominate; robust, yes--but I do not detect the chocolate or coffee promised by the brewers profile...OVERALLL: surprisingly distinctive in the genre--a truly worthwhile experience from a beer whose label suggests otherwise

Transfer from BA review on 2-18-12 - 
Poured from bottle into pint glass

Appearance  Pours a deep-deep brown nearly pitch black color with a tan head. The head fades slowly and leaves a persistent foam on the top of the beer with some very nice lacing on the sides of the glass. Quite a nice look.

Smell  Sweeter chocolate aromas with a hint of vanilla and roasted notes are consistent throughout the entire aroma. Toward the end the sweetness lightens a little bit, and gives way to a slightly more bitter chocolate aroma.

Taste  The taste matches the aroma quite nice. The nose however leads you to believe it will be sweeter then it is. In the beginning it is a little bit of sweeter chocolate mixed with vanilla and a bit of roasted coffee. The sweet chocolate although, it is only sweet in comparison to where it goes, as over time it bitters more and more, to a bitter cocoa flavor with heavy roasted notes. 

Mouthfeel  From the look I expected something a bit more heavy and syrupy in body, but instead was met with something lighter. While lighter, it did have a very creamy feel, closer to something you may expect with a dry nitrogen driven stout. The level of carbonation and body made it very easy to drink.

Overall  This was a very nice porter. Although I dont think I would consider it Robust as the name implies, it is very drinkable and good none the less.
Pours a dark black with light brown head. Has a strong coffee and chocolate aroma. Has a rich chocolate, coffee, and light malt taste, with a rich cocoa espresso aftertaste.

I poured a 12oz bottle into a nonic pint glass. It had a best by date of 7/9/14 and came as part of a mixpack for $15.99 ($1.33 per bottle or $0.11 per ounce).

Appearance: Opaque black body with a large, fluffy, frothy, dark tan head which retains and laces extremely well.

Smell: Classic dark malty aroma with hints of dairy and milk chocolate and a faint floral scent.

Taste: I drink so many experimental style beers so often that I forget how good a beer brewed in a classic style can be. Smuttynose Robust Porter is a definite to-spec robust porter and would hit every note on a BJCP taste test. Its tasty and well-balanced, though not quite to the point of a being a mind blower.

The palette begins with a sweet taste of dark malts, and looking at the recipe on the brewerys website, theres quite a lot of them here. An interesting combination of milk chocolate, cola, and maybe a hint of cherry. It becomes a little bitter through the middle with a slightly toasty flavor. This grows stronger towards the end as the Cascade hops make their presence known and impart a slight citrusy or flowery taste. Additional notes of dark chocolate complement the bitterness well. 

Drinkability: The word robust in a beers name tends to imply strong flavor and a huge body, but thats not really the case here. Though the palette is plenty flavorful, Smuttynose Robust Porter is not intense or intimidating. The mouthfeel is calm and soft with a smooth texture and finish. It does leave a slightly dry aftertaste akin to burnt toast, but its easily tolerable. For 6% ABV, this beer has the right amount of taste for its weight and is satisfying just one serving at a time.
Smooth and sweet, has a nutty flavor to it, very rich, yet very drinkable, no abv detected, one of the best porters I have ever had....top notch
Rich and full, deep caramel with subtle coffee undertones ... slightly acidic finish.
Bottle at the Rookery. Dark black with frothy white head. Aroma of roasted coffe and chocolate. Taste of roasted coffee. Medium bodied with lightly bitter aftertaste

Strong bitter clean dark with flavors of coffee and chocolate one of our favorite porters

UPDATED: MAR 2, 2014 Dark brown with a finger and a half of tan head. Aromas of roasted malts, dark chocolate, coffee, slight hop brightness. Taste follows in suit. Its a little thin, but very good for the style, bot timid on the flavor. A good easier drinking dark beer (porter).
Dark pour, big creamy tannish head. Smell is very hoppy along with milk chocoalte and a hint of latte. The flavor is nice, some smoke, some coffee, ashines, chocoalte, pumpernickel, spicy hops.

Bottle. Chocolate coffee aromas over mild carbonation. Pours black with thin creme head that dissipates. Tart coffee flavor with medium body.

Bottle @ Bishops Arms Savoy, Malmö. Black with a light brown head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, coffee and a little burnt. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish. 080214

12 oz bottle poured into a tulip glass. A fairly unique aroma combination that starts with a notable earthy/mushroom and coffee mix. After a while, I started to pick up some raisins followed by some basement-dampness. As this warms and mellows, some light alcohol notes start to poke through with a medium strength cola-caramel smell. The dark brown body is topped by a thin, light-colored espresso head that leaves a trace amount of lacing. The taste is primarily coffee bitter at a medium level with a medium/medium-light sweetness. The tongue starts out with the cola-caramel flavors and some dark fruits (plums and raisins). The medium body has an average carbonation which is oily with a bit of a grainy feel to it. A toasted, borderline burnt toast, flavor finishes the drink and leaves a strong coffee and cola aftertaste that lingers.
Really great porter, probably the best widely-available porter made in New England. Until I can get my hands on another Hill Farmstead Everett this is where Ill be going for american porter.

A decent porter. Very smokey flavored and slightly coffee flavored. Got this from my beer othe month club and had it at home.

12 oz bottle. Pours a very dark brown color almost black with a small tan head. This is an excellent porter. Good flavorful aroma with taste of coffee, expresso and chocolate and then a nice hop finish. I highly recommend this one.
UPDATED: JAN 12, 2015 Probably my favorite beer right now, intensely complex with espresso, chocolate, and some bitterness for balance. This is just a wonderful brew, A Very drinkable beer.

A dark brown beer that smells of roast coffee and chocolate and smooth earthy hops. Great porter taste of espresso, dark chocolate, some earth. Full bodied and drinkable. An awesome porter

12oz bottle served in a pint glass.

A - Pours a very dark brown(almost black). 2 fingers of dark tan foam cling to the sides of the glass and retains well creating a frothy cap.

S - Sweet roasted malts, coffee, dark chocolate, raw malts mix with roasted to create a complex aroma. Dark yeast, undercooked brown bread. Awesome!

T - Intense bitter dark chocolate overwhelms the senses. Full bodied coffee, acidic, roasted malt, hints of lactic and acidic berry fruit. Hops seem to bounce between pine and citrus at different times. Lightly sweet against the powerful coffee flavors. Bitterness goes from from to back transforming into a cocoa bitter finish.

M - Heavy body upfront but a thin liquidy feel towards the finish, light to medium drying carbonation. The finish is dry and bitter.

A dense and well....robust porter that will grab your attention for sure. The coffee and roast character is bold and very fresh. Dense and intense keep coming to mind. The mouthfeel starts full and creamy then quickly trasnitions into a thin dry finish. This is what I was hoping Founders Breakfast stout would taste like. My first Smuttynose and it will not be the last.

Serving type: bottle

Very dark almost black pour. Clear. Not much head and what is there leaves no lacing. String malty scent. Caramel and lots of smoked malts in the mouth. Raisin in the finish. Dry. Low carbonation. Thick. Filling.

12 oz. bottle. Pour oz dark brown, nearly black and opaque. A frothy milk chocolate head that leaves good lacing. Smell is roasty with chocolate, coffee and hops. Taste is sweet caramel and sweet bitter chocolate followed by bitter coffee notes and a slightly hoppy finish. Nice porter.

Poured from a 12oz. into a pint glass.....copper malty in color with aromas of coffee and chocolate. The malts and barley lend to the smooth taste and smell. Solid beer.

Bottle from Total Wine in Stuart for my 950th rating, and my 50th porter, as a line of demarcation - final one of 13 as well, I am guessing. Pours a very dark brown with a tan head leaving some lacing. Aroma has chocolate caramel and some roast. Taste is chocolate heavy, with sweet milk chocolate and some bittersweet bakers chocolate present, also a solid roastiness with caramel. Medium to full bodied and fairly rich and dry. Finishes just to the sweet side of bittersweet - choco/caramel winning over the bitter roast/bakers chocolate sides. One of the earliest porters ever had is still a very enjoyable one.

Fantastic porter. Great roasted aroma with hints of coffee. Very dark color with a foamy head. Medium to higher weight. Decent carbonation. Strong roasted flavors with coffee and some chocolate but as enhancements that dont overshadow the true nature of this great beer. Some hops bitterness on the finish but not distracting. Great first impression of the brewery.

UPDATED: FEB 16, 2016 Dark brown with a yellow note and a two finger high, brown-beige head. A lot of lacing stays on the glass. 

Nose: Coffee, roasted malt and nuts. Coffee beans, vanilla, dark bread, toffee and sweet licorice.

Bottle to half-pint glass (shared with the Mrs.). Best by 02/15/14. Looks good; a semi-opaque dark cola with foamy beige head. Smells solid; dark malt, chocolate, and roast. Tastes like it smells with a solid, albeit slightly bitter mouthfeel. Enjoyable.

Brun foncé, garnit dune mousse beige qui se colle à la parois du verre pour baver des traces organisées. Pours dark brown with a tan head. Notes of caramel, malt, and coffee. This one was another strong one....stronger than expected. I thought the aftertaste was like ash. I like a good porter, but this one didnt do anything for me.

12 oz. bottle from The Party Source. Glad Im finally catching up with this one. One of the most-rated beers I havent gotten to, as well as one of the highest-rated porters I havent had. Anyway, it pours a nice deep brown color with an initially big, rocky, frothy tan head that settles into a small cap and leaves some lace. Looks the part. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, roasted malts, nuts, and earth. Flavor of chocolate, coffee, earth, dry leaves, and nuts. Simple, straightforward, and smooth. Light-bodied, with a smooth, lightly roasted mouthfeel and moderate soft carbonation. Nice porter. Very, very easy to drink.

Pours deep mahogany with moderate head. Burnt cereal notes in aroma. Taste is a fruity dark chocolate soon taken over by the hops. Hops are fairly aggressive for this style. Leaves a little bit of a metallic aftertaste along with an ashy dryness.

Not a bad Porter it wasn't carbonated too much nice chocolate taste.

2013 bottle to a pint glass. Pours black with a huge khaki head that is spongey on the bottom and settles to a creamy dollop in top. Good sticky lacing. Pours a dark opaque brown with just a bit of highlight. A thick head of tan foam with great retention and excellent lacing. Aroma is very nice with a balanced combination of coffee and sweet cream with a bit of chocolate. Taste is indeed robust with brewed coffee being dominate along with some roastiness. There is a bit of sweetness in the middle with some chocolate and a moderate roasty and charred bitterness that lingers into the finish. Mouthfeel hints at being creamy and is medium bodied with moderate carbonation. I really enjoyed this beer. Nothing very complex but flavors are well orchestrated and downright tasty. I'd choose this over many beers that have coffee added, for a coffee fix.
Pours a black brown color with a foamy canvas colored head. Notes of coffee, dark chocolate, smoke, and caramel. Creamy full mouthfeel.

Bottle in NH. Pours deep brown with a large, frothy beige head. Dusty cocoa on the nose, moderate roast and burnt toast. Medium sweet flavor with lovely charred wood, rich and dry chocolate, strong roast, dried fruits, faint raisins. Medium bodied with fine carbonation. Very well balanced to finish, plenty of richly roasted malts, char and ash, dark cocoa, mellow earthy bitterness. Exceptional stuff. Respect to Smuttynose for making such solid ore beers. These boys have been killing it for years and really dontt get enough attention.

Bottle- Dark brown/blackish. Dark Tan head fizzes up and subsides quick. When you first sip it, the first mouthful that pops out is the earthy burning smoked wood. I also can flavor up some coffee, nuts, dark chocolate, and some figs maybe. Very smooth, well balanced, and full bodied. A very good Robust porter. It makes me want to go pick up a lady with one arm too!

Bottle - thanks, J! Pours nearly black with dark tan head. Aroma dominated by sweet milky chocolate; some sugar, just a hint of coffee. Taste is much drier than nose - lightly sweet, roasted coffee bitterness that lingers nicely. Palate: medium body, average carbonation, just a shade thin. Overall: really nice porter.

Bottle into pint glass. A: roasty, resin, leather, oatmeal. A: black as night, tan foam. T: Chocolate sweetness, coffee. P: medium body, sticky, flat. This is a sweet thick porter and I really dig it.

Im not too crazy about the bottle, but this one presents a great chocolate coffee aroma that surrounds your nose. It exhibits a pretty nice head and is great in cooler weather. Im impressed with all of Smuttynoses more roasted beers. This one fits in perfectly with the likes of Old Brown Dog and Really Old Brown Dog but takes it to the next level.
Tap. Pours dark amber with thick toffee colored head. Malty aroma with splashes of chocolate and coffee. Taste heavier on the coffee and roastiness.
Pours a dark brown/black with a thin mocha head. Aroma of roasty malt, chocolate and coffee. Taste is bitter chocolate, coffee and roasted malt. Carb is way over the top.

pours dark black with a small tan head. This porter has a very malty coffee flavor. It is lightly sweet and lightly bitter. There is an unsweetened chocolate flavor with a strong dark fruit taste and a light roasted flavor.

FROM NOTES: July 2, 12
Served on tap at the Smuttynose Brewery into a pint glass. 

A: Very roasty. The roasted malts take on a dark chocolate and coffee character. 
A: Pours a very dark, almost black, color with a thick, brown head that stays throughout the beer and exceptional head retention. A great looking beer. 
T: Follows the nose with a very roasted flavor, but also a nice bitter hop bite. This beer is appropriately named --ery robust. 
P: Medium body and medium carbonation. 
O: Among the best porters Ive tasted.

Once I realized there was a NH brewed shelf beer in the top 10 porter category I had to have it. Thanks Nick for snagging it out of a mix 12pk for me. Very dark brown black with a awesome mocha head that stays as a film. Smell is roast malt, espresso, slight cocoa. Taste is robust! Strong roast, black coffee, and a hint of dark chocolate. Some traces of hop bitterness. Tasty beer that I have shrugged off in the past.

This is a fine porter, and the name suits it. It pours a rich, viscous brown with a medium head that leaves a ton of lace. The aroma is smokey malt, with black walnut notes and a little bit of vanilla. The flavor adds a bit of bakers chocolate and a mild tingle in the finish. Delicious.
12 ounce bottle. Big black pour with tan head. Big chocolate taste. Coffee. Rich and big for low abv. Solid.

Aroma: Wow. Only 5.7%? HUGE roasted malt nose; dark chocolate, waffle cone, fig jam. Would have guessed this was an Imperial Stout from the aroma alone; bonus points for that. Appearance: Oily, pitch black pour with a huge, bubbly mocha head. Flavor: Not quite as complex as the nose, but still very nice. Roast character is dominant, and the chocolate is there- a bit more simple than the nose suggests. Palate: Full body, oily texture, soft carbonation, long finish. Overall: Wonderful beer; highly recommended.

On tap at Bar Louie. Pours black with creamy tan head and minimal lacing. Chocolate notes. Taste of mild chocolate and roasted malts. A little thin compared to what I'm used to for a porter but solid none the less.
