This beer if you can find it ship it to the less unfortunate. It goes down nice with a slab of meat on the grill. Definitely will have to try it with the veggie platter as well.
Poured from a bottle. Dark brown color, medium tan frothy head. Roasted malt smell. Slightly acidic coffee and roasted malt flavor.
UPDATED: FEB 21, 2014 Great head with lacing, dark brown, more of a chocolate smell than taste. Creamy, but not as flavorful as I?d hoped.

Quite dark brown with tinge of orange, small tan head. Aroma chocolate and roasted nuts. Medium-light body. Flavor up front is rather chocolaty, some roasted malt, nice dry finish. Flavors quite good if a bit thin on the palate.

Nice hints of chocolate, after taste was very lite and did not stick around long. It's a porter I will defiantly go back to.

26/09/2013 Brasserie 4:20 (handpump, 2009). Nera, impenetrabile, schiuma abbondante color bianco sporca, abbastanza persistente. Al naso sentori di malti tostati, segni di ossidazione e infezione. In bocca è sgradevole, piatta, manca totalmente di corpo, tostato e acido, un mezzo disastro. Non ha retto i 4 anni, troppi per una birra del genere.

(bottle) pours a slightly hazy deepest ruby colour with a frothy off-white head. aroma of milk chocolate, toffee, light vanilla and paint, slightly earthy, with a hint of soy sauce. flavour is mostly caramel, toasted malts and milk chocolate, with a hint of tobacco and a light roasted-bitter finish. medium to full-bodied with average carbonation.

This pours pitch black with a slight hue to it. A scant tan head of creamy foam that fell fast to a film and a ring and left sticky lace. Looks deep and like it never ends. 

Nose is big and bright. There is a nice fruity scent of berries on top of a dark roasted malt. Coffee, chocolate and a light sweetness. There is no alcohol on the nose. It even has a faint touch of lemon rind that adds even more brightness. Caramel as the malt warms and some nutty qualities too. Its complex on the nose and as it unfolds it gets deeper and more vivid. 

Taste is so wonderful. Its the deft combination of dark roasted malt and those bright sweet fruits that greet the palate. Then you notice the chocolate and are delighted. The coffee is blended with it perfectly and they are inseparable. The malt is soft and it s caramel sweetness is full and with the nutty flavors it tastes sticky and sweet. It has a grainy edge to it and that is carried in the mouthfeel. The hop floral is faint but its there to add lightness to the body. Its hearty and creamy at the same time. The dark malt even imparts a bitter that keeps everything rolling across the tongue for a complex and rich drink without heaviness. 

Smuttynose has really done a terrific porter here. My favorite of its aspects is the light berry-like fruit. So many times dark fruits impart a heavier quality to a beer like this one but this is just buoyant on the palate. Balanced perfectly and drinks with a delightfully long aftertaste. Tremendous!

A burnt character as to style is pleasant and noticeable. I also get coffee, toffee aromatics on the nose. The color is black with a tan head with poor head retention. Burnt toasty flavor with coffee highlights and a lingering bitterness from a combination of the roast malt and the hops. Medium body with a medium-high carbonation and an astringency that hangs on the tongue and lets u know its a robust porter. Overall, a good example of a robust porter, but it could be improved with a more complex malt bill.

12oz bottle into snifter glass. Pours a dark brown with a hint of mahogany, light beige head. Aroma of burnt coffee and caramel, with the same plus some dark chocolate flavour. A bit smoky. A delightful porter.
12 ounce bottle. Pours dark brown with a small biege head. Aroma of malt and chocolate. Taste is roasted malt, dark chocolate, coffee, caramel, and dark fruit. Very good.

Best before Otober 15, 2013.
Appearance:The body is very dark, but light can be seen through the mahogany and garnet hued body, showing off great clarity. The head is dense with great retention, settling into a creamy tan coating.
Aroma: The aroma is light of earth and cocoa with a bittersweet dark chocolate presence.
Taste: Semi-sweet cocoa and creamer greets the tongue immediately coming off slightly bitter into a slightly astringent mid-taste with a backing of caramel coming strongly towards the finish with fruity black cherry hints. The finish is abrupt and semi-dry.
Palate: Medium bodied with moderate carbonation.
Overall: This is a solid as heck porter, well worth the $9 price tag for a 6 pack and well worth buying even with Edmund Fitzgerald and Founders Porter on the shelf.

Bottle. Dark brown color, amber-brown spongy large head, coffee aroma, mild carbonation, slightly bitter coffee nuts taste, long finish. Very nice porter.

-Fish!

Poured from a 12 fl oz bottle into a snifter. Some months past the indicated best by date, but carefully cellared. 

Very dark reddish-brown in color. Nearly black in the snifter. Light brown head soon reduces to a robust ring and some islands, but leaves exceptional lacing on the sides. 

Aroma: a fine, rich and complex aroma of dried fruit, fine alcohol esters, coffee, dark roasted grains and a hint of chocolate. Faint trace of charred malts. (False) hints of barrel aging. 

Taste: A load of dark roasted malts, with some dark coffee, and a hint of dried plums. Mildly bitter, coffee-tinged aftertaste. 

Feel: Full bodied. Moderate carbonation. Nicely smooth but slightly astringent. 

Overall: a great example of the style and a very big beer for such a low ABV.
Over-rated. Dark brown pour with off white head. Aroma is musty. Taste is burnt caramel.

UPDATED: NOV 16, 2013 Great roasty aroma, near-black pour with a milk-chocolate head. Also smell some fruity hop notes and some chocolate in the aroma. More roasted chocolate in the flavors, along with a bit of vaporizing alcohol. Thick and heavy as a porter should be, it leaves sort of a chalky lingering mouthfeel paired with a charred aftertaste. Seems to be some variability between batches, recently had a bottle that tasted a bit *too* charred, but usually an excellent buy. Absolutely delicious and one of my favorite beers, luckily its cheap and available everywhere around Boston!
Very good and aromatic. Quite decent and with dark hints. NIce creamy and easy to drink.

Pours a really dark brown but lets say black topped by a small ring of tan foam. Aroma is what I call "porter": rich dark chocolate, burnt grains and maybe a bit of coffee. Taste is quite dry (like it should) with a good amount of bitterness (coming from the hops? Maybe. But it feels more like burnt/roasted grains really). Flavors are charred nuts, bitter chocolate and a bit of moka. Mouthfeel is quite soft with a lower carbonation level. A nice one!

On tap at World of Beers (Raleigh)

Very dark as befits a good porter. Very mild aroma with a relatively mild taste featuring coffee. Not a dark or harsh taste. Aftertaste stresses coffee. 

Not bad. Not great, but not bad. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle courtesy of AirForceHops. Earthy roassty malt, chocolate, and creamy mocha aroma. Black brown with a huge tan head, nice lacing.  Earthy roasty coffee, chocolate, and light ashy flavor with a roasty bitter finish. Body on the light side of medium, moderate carbonation.
Not much aroma.  Decent taste, not too hoppy.  (We are not big hop fans.)  Good taste but not much aftertaste.
Just the right balance of flavor and body to make it a year-round, every-day porter. Not many can do that. Smoke and roasted malts are there, but not heavy-handed. Finishes dry and pleasantly bitter.
Väldigt svart kropp. Rostig, kan hinta en ytterst lite rökighet. Lite citrus, viss sötma i aroman från alkoholen.

Westmeisters Birthday Beer Tasting Extravaganza Beer #7.  Brought to the tasting by a longtime friend who mostly prefers to drink Miller High Life.  All things considered, he chose well.  Smells of coffee and chocolate while pouring black with a tan head.  Flavor is chocolatey and roasty.  Mouthfeel is just a touch oily.  Bottle - Westmeisters House - Cumming, GA

Lovely dark brew. Like a true porter, its smooth easy drinking after work. A fabulous everyday beer for those of us who know that dark beers are not simply a winter phenomenon. Good notes of coffee, toastiness, delicious yum yum time.
Bottle. Dark, black. Good milk chocolately vibes. Roasted tones. Body is medium, a bit light for the intensivity on the nose.-- bb/h(n9)

Dark brown body with thick brownish head with fair lacing.  Strong aromas of dark roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, some cardboard. Body is quite thick , low in carbonation, dry and very bitter. Not well balanced, very bitter aftertaste.
330 ml bottle. Aroma malt, biscuit, caramel and some perfume. Taste is malty and grainy. Finish is very herby and bitter.

Poured into an imperial pint glass it fills in nicely with a light coffee color head on top of an almost black body. Has almost a faint coffee smell mixed with malt. A little too far on the malty side for me (although thats primarily because the taste associates slightly with soy sauce personally). Other than that it was a full and rich beer which I would have again.

12 oz. bottle from "the Beer Cave" at the Kane County Cougars stadium in Geneva, IL.. Poured to plastic with a black/brown hue, a modest but frothy, brownish tan head, and a quickly diminishing ring of lacing. Both aroma and taste were chocolate, roasted coffee, and just a touch of woody smokiness. The body was medium to full, with a mouthfeel that had a nice creaminess to it, and no bite to the moderate hop bitterness. Went down smoothly as I enjoyed the game.
Bottle.  Pours really dark.  Another porter, better than most. Nothing to say really.

Bottle. The pour is dark with little head. The aroma is a standard porter, lots of malt. The taste is good up front, a mouthful. Fades a little at the end and all you get is some smoke. A good porter. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours black from the bottle with a creamy kahki head that sticks around. Aroma of coffee and chocolate, with lots of roasty malt. Very smooth mouthfeel with medium carbonation. Coffee and roastiness abound with a hint of chocolate. Hops come in but really fade into a creamy flavorful porter. Very nice beer.
UPDATED: JAN 25, 2014 Bottle->Pokal.  Deep brown with huge frothy tan head.  Aroma: roasted malt with notes of chocolate and coffee.  Taste: bitter chocolate, roast, coffee grinds.  Very good.

Rated 3/17/13. 12 oz bottle says 5.7%. Poured into a pint glass.

A: Pours a very dark brown color with good opacity for the style. The head is a two finger mocha shade. It takes a while for the head to recede away, and it leaves beautiful lacing down the glass.

S: This one is very forward in coffee, dry chocolate, roasted barley, and slight hop qualities. The hops come across in a faded manner - and honestly, thats a good thing.

T: The strongest note here is that of roasted barley, creating a coffee expression when mixed with the (faded) hops. The hops do come across a bit citrusy on the back end, but its balanced with the rich unsweetened chocolate and coffee flavors. Id say this is the perfect age for this one (two months before the best by date) - some hoppiness is there, just doing enough to balance any malty sweetness without providing an overbearing acidic nature.

M: I like how balanced the mouthfeel is: its dry enough to be easy to drink, yet theres enough of a lingering flavor to interest the palate. It could use a bit more body, but thats just nitpicking, really.

O: Not much to say here, its a great porter that Ive been ignoring for far too long. As I said before, this bottle is at the perfect age for consumption.
Poured from a 12 oz bottle.  Dark brown, tan head.  Aroma is roasted malt and coffee, some chocolate.  Taste is similar - coffee/espresso flavor is prevalent.  Smooth beer, very drinkable.

Bottle. Pouts black with a big khaki head. Settles to lacing. Aroma is chocolate and roasted malt. Chocolate fades to the aftertaste, lots of roasted malt up front in the taste. Mouthfeel is a little thin. Decent but not exciting. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12oz bottle. Pours a light black with a tan head. Aromas of chocolate, coffee, sweet caramel malt along with some spicy/earthy hops. Taste is coffee, chocolate, toasted bread, and slight oak/wood notes.

Great porter. Looks impressive poured into a glass, black body with one and a half finger brown foam head.  Nice smell of some coffee, roasted malt.  Taste of some black licorice, espresso, and finishes with some slight bitterness.   Very drinkable and enjoyable - complex but not too heavy.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bouteille 12oz, courtoisie de Hogtownharry ou Blankboy. De couleur brune-noire et opaque. Nez de chocolat noir, de café noir,  de malt rôti doux et léger de vanille avec des notes fruitées (cerises noires) et houblon herbeux. Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen et une texture moyennement crémeuse. Faibles notes fruitées (cerises noires) et boisées (bois humide) ainsi quun léger goût de vanille lors de lentrée en bouche rapidement suivi dun goût de chocolat noir et de malt rôti. Parallèlement, des goûts de café doux  et de houblon herbeux se rajoutent progressivement pour dominer la finale . Post-goût long et légèrement sec, moyen-léger amer de rôti, moyen de café, léger de houblon herbeux avec des notes de chocolat noir. (2006)

This pours a dark brown color with a slight, beige head. There is a fairly decent scent of coffee, black licorice, and caramel malts. The taste is heavy and complex. There are a lot of bold robust flavors mixed with some smoky hints. There are lots of roasted grains and sweet malts. Very well made for a porter!
From old notes, need a re-review: Coffee, chocolate, roasted nuts. Hardy and pleasant aftertaste.
Snappy aroma of coffee, milk and cherries. Dark body with brown head. Taste of coffee, dark chocolate. Palate is maybe a little thin, but okay. Overall, a nice tasty porter.

Refrigerated 12 oz. brown bottle, best before February 29, 2012 (oops) set on the counter for a bit and poured into a shaker.  Pours black with very  small beige head.  Some small bubble lacing, medium body, medium carbonation, and roasty aroma.  Taste is dry coffee, dark chocolate, hint of cherry, and bitter slightly herbal hops.  Good porter, better as it warms.
Dark with a tan head. Aroma is sweet malty, coffee-ish, chocolate. Full, slick mouth. Flavor is roasted, semi-sweet chocolate, light molasses. FInish was mildly dry. Very nice porter.

Very stout like pour and judging from appearance this is already living up to its name. On the aroma Im picking up a lot of bitter black coffee and semi-sweet chocolate with a nice roasted quality. The taste is up front with coffee and more of those roasted notes, bitter chocolate and finishes with some hop bitterness. The mouth feel is medium to full bodied. This is a porter that lives up to its name, exactly what comes to mind when i picture a porter.
Dark, smells terrific, tastes wonderfully smoky.  This is what a beer should be...started thinking ipa?s were my favorite until this reminded me that nothing beats a good porter

On tap. Poured very dark, almost black with a tan head. Was a bit warm and flat, I think something was wrong with the draught system as another beer I had was warm and flat too. Still good coffee and chocolate notes, a very drinkable porter.
UPDATED: FEB 7, 2013 Very nice beer. Great rich coffee aroma. Taste follows but with dark chocolate and a somewhat  bitter finish. Good porter.

It poured a nice black with a half inch foamy off-white/tan head leaving a superb foamy spider web lacing, very ringy. The smell had chocolate malts combined very nicely with a nice roastiness. The taste had the chocolate overpowering pretty much everything else, but in a good way, nothing overbearing, just really good balanced really well with the coffee. The palate was about a medium, perhaps maybe even closer to a heavier feel with nothing harsh on the tongue. Overall, this is good for the style and very good to me.

Bottle for trade with umich03jm. Pours black, with a good lasting head. Aroma is light with roasted malt. Flavor is also roasted with moderate bitterness. Finishes dry. Would prefer a little more depth to the flavor and more substantial mouthfeel.
Slight wet dog aroma. Sanguine palate, good bitter hop presence. Solid, and yes, robust porter.

Bottle.  Black pour with great mocha head.  Roasty.  A slightly but not offensively burnt roast. Caramel.  Sour and bitter.  Medium body 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bonus in trade w/ phatgog1. Thanx.  Black pour.  Minimal head.  Very dark malty aroma.  Slight licorice.  A touchgood of smoke.  No sweeetness in this one.  Above medium thickness. Pretty smooth.  Suprised by this one.  Better than i expected.
Porter glass- not a strong aroma but a scent of black coffee and dark chocolate is present. Goes down very smooth with little carbonation, just doesn't have enough taste to be a great porter.

Poured from a 12 ounce bottle into a brandy snifter. Pours a translucent dark brown with a velvety, khaki colored head of foam. Nice sheets of lacing as well. The aroma has lots of dark coffee, cacao nibs, cinnamon, and a touch of marshmallow. Really nice aroma. Taste is roasty and slightly bitter. Bitterness kicks in hard toward the backend. Thick on the tongue and rests on the tongue for a while. Long finish.
Bottle. Dark brown color, amber-brown spongy large head, coffee aroma, mild carbonation, slightly bitter coffee nuts taste, long finish. Very nice porter.
UPDATED: JAN 2, 2015 Bottle, brown pour with white head, nose and taste are both super coffee and chocolate, nice

Too dark in the pink to really tell what it looks or smells like. 

Malty, coffee, dark chocolate. Nice body and finishes with some bitter hops. 

Not big into smutty nose, but this is good!
The aroma started off promising with chocolate notes. The palate is too thin to be a really good beer.
Has a roasty caramel aroma with hints of coffee. Dark black color, with frothy head. A very heavy sweet beer with medium bitter taste.  Full body with bitter finish. Overall this beer is excellent.

Pours a deep burnt umber color with a two finger mocha foam. On the nose its roasted malts and rich chocolate with a hint of coffee. On the palate its just like the nose with a nice creamy mouthfeel and nice bubble to liven up the roasted dark flavors. Nice coffee and chocolate on the finish ! Solid beer and lucky for it to be a local under 10 dollar six pack !

Bottle.  Pours dark brown with average, creamy tan head; decent retention and spare lacing.  Aroma is roasted and caramel malts, dates, figs, light earthy hops, chocolate, and light coffee. Flavor is roast malt forward with light smoke, dark fruit esters, faint hops, and light chocolate; dry, ashy finish.  Medium body and carbonation.
Not much in the way of aroma. Pours like a normal porter with a diminishing tan head. Flavor is pretty robust but rather a watered down taste. Not bad would recommend as a fine brew, but not great

12oz bottle - pours black with beige head and spotty lacing. Nose is roasted malts, dark chocolate and grass. Flavor adds borderline burnt malts and coffee. Bitter start and finish with faint sweetness sandwiched in. Medium to full body. Dry. Would have liked more sweetness.

Pours a dense black with a tan head that hangs around a while. Aromas of roasted feet, unemployed people eating liquorish. Decent. Taste is watery roasted blackness, with EBT cards. Ashtrays. An OK beer.

Poured from a 12 ounce bottle into a sam adams glass. Pours a nice dark color with a light tan head that lasts a decent while. A nice creamy roasted malt aroma with notes of vanilla and coffee and maybe some chocolate. Flavor is initially bitter maybe a little dry and creamy. I can pick up the roasted malt but not so much of the coffee and chocolate. Medium body a little dry carbonation is average. Overall a decent beer.
Dark chocolate, coffee, vanilla on both palate and aroma. Draft, medium body mouthfeel.
Robust initially, but finishes slightly thin. Balanced and smooth. Not too roasted. Drinkable.
Pours black,  brown head,   aroma of grape coffe. .taste is coffe,  chocolate  very smooth and well put to gether,  awesome porter!
black color, aroma of roasted malts, pine hops, flavors of chocolate, coffee, roasted malt, creamy texture, seasonable but with lots of flavor, very solid
Rich brown color. Creamy beige head lasts forever. Light toasty creamy aroma. Vanilla oak roasted barley flavor balanced flavor. Goes awesome with a filet and Michael Jordans

UPDATED: SEP 7, 2013 Pours a nice black color with a small beige head that fades away slowly.  Aroma is a nice mix of chocolate, coffee, cream, light fruit, and a small amount of smoke.  Taste is pretty creamy, lots of chocolate and coffee.  Theres a nice fruitiness that comes through in the finish along with a little smoke.  A little spiciness in the finish too.  This is a thick full bodied porter with a rich malt taste.  Lots of flavor packed in and only 5.7%.  This is a sipper with a relatively small abv.

Chocolate bar! This is a fantastic porter. Deep dark and really tasty. Highly recommended.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Very dark brown in color with a tan head. Chocolate, some coffee, malts and notes of grassy hops in aroma. Sweet chocolate, roasted coffee, some wood and light notes of licorice. Delicious one.

The pour is dark brown with a thick mocha head that leaves great lacing.  The aroma is full of malt, chocolate, and roasted notes.  The taste follows through and is very smooth.  It has a nice creamy mouthfeel and is perfect in body.  Its light and drinkable but full of wonderful flavors!  Complex but possibly sessionable.  You dont see that often.  Very, very good!

UPDATED: MAY 9, 2013 Pours almost, if not black, no light through at all, small frothy khaki head thin lacing. milk chocolate and roasts malts dominate the nose, bitter coffee and slight floral hops present. Taste is opposite order of the nose with bitter coffee and floral hops up front, chocolate is of unsweetened variety mid mouth, sweet milk chocolate is not there as it is in the aroma, lots of roast malt and black coffee throughout.  Medium body, good carbonation, slight alcohol heat present, but of sting from the roast malt dominance, mouthful is a strong point of thus wonderful beer.  I have had better porters, but this one is up there, I will be drinking plenty more of this.
Appearance is a dark thick black with a nice caramel head. Aroma is malty and sweet. Taste is also malty, but with a bitter overly sugary finish. Palate is a little liquidy, but frothy.

Roasted malts and chocolate comprise the aroma. A brownish black pour with a mostly lasting tan head. Taste is mildly bitter. Roasted malts, coffee, chocolate with a hint of hoppy citrus in the finish.  Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Slightly fizzy. Overall, a very rewarding and drinkable porter. Well done!

Bottle. Pours black with a tan head. The tan head quickly dissipates and leaves thin lacing on the glass. Aroma is cocoa powder and coffee, hints of roasted malts are in there too. Flavor is fresh roasted coffee, very similar to a nice iced coffee.  Followed by hints of caramel and a bite from hops comes in at the end. On the palate the beer is very smooth and finishes clean and nicely carbonated.
Sample @ SBWF 12. Black colour with a tan head. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, raisin. Dry bitter chocolate, coffee flavour.
Poured dark black with a thick frothy tan head. Aroma of dark fruit, roasted coffee and dark chocolate. Full creamy body, flavour of roasted malt and dark chocolate with a lingering dry finish.

Very dark brown, nearly black, tan head. Nose is toasty malt with chocolate and coffee, notes of grapefruity hops. Taste has a slight malty-sour note balanced out nicely by the sharp roastiness and the coffee-and-hops bitterness. Not overly complicated, but a nice balance. Medium body, somewhat oily palate, soft carbonation.

Pours a rich, thick dark brown/black impenetrable to light with a small brown head that stays on top. Brew smells like milk chocolate, with some lighter coffee notes. Medium thick bodied with a good bit of carbonation. Taste of dry porter, milk chocolate being the major backdrop with coffee flavors accentuating the bitterness. Super dry finish, great for any porter fan.

Bottle. Dark brown body, medium tan head. Aroma has a mix of coffee beans and milk chocolate. Very smooth and rich malty taste with chocolate and roast. Finish has some light coffee sourness and hoppiness. Highly drinkable. An excellent porter indeed.

Bottled.  Pours black, beige, head.  Mellow aroma of milk chocolate.  Smooth flavors of toffee and caramel up front, with bit of fruit underneath.  Touch of alcohol on the finish with some bitter coffee notes.  Rich mouthfeel, full-bodied.  Tasty porter.

black colour with dark brown head. some chocolate on the nose. taste is light sweetness and salty. Aftertaste is a long one which plays all over ur mouth and makes this beer so great. chocolate malty hop dryness. body is a bit too light imo.

330ml bottle. Pitch black color. Medium fizzy tan head appears, disappears quickly. Roasted, coffee, malty, cocoa beans in aroma. Roasted malts, coffee, cocoa and dark chocolate in flavor. Somewhat fizzy texture. Quite long lasting roasted aftertaste.

Bottle (12 oz). Dark brown with a medium mostly diminishing beige head and some lacing. Aroma of chocolate, roasted malt and slight citrus. Taste is moderately sweet with slight bitterness. Mouthfeel is oily. This porter is right on style. Good balance. Not exceptional but  no real flaws either.

On tap at The Reservoir in Waterbury, VT. Pours near-black with a small creamy tan head. Aroma of mildly roasted malts and some light espresso notes  certainly smells like a porter. Flavour is more robust, as the name suggests, with lots of roasted malts and a prominent hop component  not enough to be a black IPA, but enough to round this off. Excellent porter.

Great porter packed with lots of flavor.  Notes of cocoa, mocha, coffee and malty caramel.  Pours very dark with a thin head that dissipates quick leaving no lacing.  This is a rich and thick porter.  Loved it and will try again soon.

Pours black, with a tall, thick, dark tan head.
Scent is sweetly roasted chocolate malt.
Taste is strong chocolate/coffee...
Sweet with a hint of bitter.
Very smooth and soft.
An excellent porter.
Dark reddish brown with a tiny off white head. Malty with fruity notes. Malt, fruit, chocolate and coffee. medium body with along, dry finish.

Tap @ The Gutter in Brooklyn with e. Black pour with a cocoa brown head. Sweet chocolate aroma. The palate is not as thin as most other porters and the flavor is distinctly fudgy and roasty. Salt water taffey? Really good porter.

Dark mahogany brown with a big strong rocky head that held forever and left excellent lace. Aroma is all roasted malts with just a touch of floral hops and coffee. Flavors are similar - big roasted malt with plenty of coffee, strong chocolate malt and a hints of ripened dark fruit and floral hops. Medium body, soft mouthfeel, modest carbonation and a finish rich in chocolate and coffee malts. Very nice.

Bottle shared.  Pours very dark brown with a tan head.  Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, coffee and wood with a little smoke.  Flavour is medium sweet and bitter.  Medium bodied with very soft carbonation.

Smells pungent and roasty. There is a little booze and some heavy coffee. Pours black with great lacing ad mocha head. Taste has a touch of sweetness and lots of roasty coffee bitters. Some good basement musk. Palate is pretty thick, rolls off tongue. Lots of goodness here. Bottle from Winooski bev.

Bottle.  Pours a very dark brown, with a strong tan head.  Malty, nutty aroma.  Coffee, nuts, and a bit of chocolate are the main notes in the malty flavor profile - not much in the way of hops.  A bit of a soapy aftertaste.  Mouthfeel is a bit thin.  A decent enough porter, but not really deserving of its high rating, in my opinion.

Bottle poured a deep black with a large tan head and minimal lacing.  Aroma includes coffee, roasted malt, vanilla, and bakers chocolate.  Taste begins with smoke and roasted malt before bittersweet chocolate and espresso bitterness are introduced.  Big mouthfeel with palatable bitterness lingering long after each sip.

12 onz bottle thx Jf and Jess. A: coffee, chocolate, with some earthy note. A bit of caramel. App: dark brown close to black. Beige head. T/p: body is full finish is roasty/acidic. Oilly texture. Carbonation is average.O: Really good I may have found a close competitor to London porter, my fav for the style.

Poured out of a bottle into a tulip glass. Very dark, though when held to the light there is a slight reddish hue. A short head that quickly retreated to the edge of the glass.

Before even breathing in I can smell it. Amazing dark malt and coffee, but the coffee is more of a burnt smell and there is a little cocoa.

Taste: Roasted malt, bitter, and the taste of chewing on a coffee bean. The bitterness clings to the back of my mouth for awhile afterward. These are all good characteristics. The taste matches its appearance.

Light for a porter, but very pleasant. A bit of creaminess to it. I usually expect a little more body to a porter though.

Very good. My first Smuttynose and based off this great beer Ill be trying to find some more.

On draft at tm wine bar in Nashua, NH. Pours a dark brown with a tan head. Nose is roasted coffee, espresso, earth.  Flavor is similar with roast, coffee, espresso, and earth. Medium body with lingering earthy coffee in the finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

35,5 cl bottle @ home. Rated on 25.03.2011
Aroma is a bit ashy with some licorice, coffee and chocolate. Flavour is rich, dry and bitter with ash, chocolate, some coffee and licorice. A brilliant Porter especially when looking at the ABV. Leaves your mouth dry and sticky.
Overall an amazing brew, complex and pretty well balanced. a good.roasted taste. amazing porter.

Coffee, chocolate, and smokey roast in the aroma.  Flavor starts sweet and bready, with roast coffee/chocolate in the finish.  Great balance between sweet malt and hop/coffee bitterness.  Really good.

Pours a black with a nice tan head.  Rich aroma of coffee on top of chocolate, cocoa, and a touch of raisin.  Taste is what I was expecting from the aroma, but much more so.  Robust as this one boasts.  Huge in coffee, with the chocolate and cocoa as undertones.  Very earthy overall.  Medium bodied with a slick texture.  Long bitter coffee aftertaste.  I guess if you like coffee, youd be happy with this one.  I am quite thrilled.

12 oz bottle poured into Stone IRS tulip.  Pours a deep black with a huge tan/brown head!  Reduces to a 1/4".  Aroma is chocolate/coffee dominant, with some roast in the background.  This is totally sublime.  Taste is on the sweetish side with only slight bitterness in the aftertaste.  Medium body with a slick texture.  Carbonation is lively, I really liked that.  Finish is medium long.  Overall well...I think this is my new favorite porter!  I just cant believe it!  Only 1.83$/bottle at Winooski Beverage Warehouse...if only we could have this in Canada!  Only thing which is negative in this tasting experience: I didnt buy a 6-pack...!  Only one!  Shame on me!  Would drink this every weekend.

31/V/2012 - 12Fl. Oz. bottle @ Klaas place - BB: n/a (2012-561) Thanks to Klaas for sharing the beer!
Clear dark brown beer, small beige head, unstable, little adhesive. Aroma: caramel, mocha, dark chocolate, coffee, dried fruits, some raisins. MF: good carbon, medium body. Taste: mocha, caramel, milk chocolate, bit spicy, somewhat sour, coffee. Aftertaste: mocha, bit sour, some caramel, raisins, little floral. Very impressive for a 5.7%!!
I like this one... good strong notes of coffee in it and a thick drink. I dont get much chocolate in it, but I like this drink.

12oz bottle poured into a shaker. Pours a very very dark brown with about a finger of dark tan head. Aroma is mostly chocolate and a little bit of grassy hops. Taste is light biter. Mostly dark chocolate and coffee with some grassy hops. Full bodied with a thick texture. Lively carbonation and a long finish. Overall, very good. Ill have to pick up a 6-pack of this next time I go out!

This porter lives up to its "robust" claim. it tastes more like a stout than a porter. 

Toasted coffee head on top of brownish black body. Lots of lacing on the glass. Impressive roasted coffee, malt, dark chocolate aroma with hop. More hop than most porters. Again roasted coffee, malt, dark chocolate taste and medium weight. Smooth, creamy finish.
4th August 2009Cask at GBBF. Opaque black beer. Light palate, a little crisp. Grassy spicy hops over a light touch of dark malt. Very tasty.
Deep black with barely any head. Aroma of coffee and dark chocolate. Taste of cocoa, with a little coffee, quite dry chocolate taste with some toffee and caramel. Pretty solid, but a bit watery.
Delightful Porter. Smell is coffee. toffee and chocolate. Taste is robust and roasty.
Poured nice out of the bottle, a dark, rich color. Coffee and dark chocolate scents you expect from a solid porter, the coffee takes over on the back end when you taste it. Overall, a solid beer.

Bottle purchased at Ale Wine & Spirits. Darkest brown pour with a thin beige head. Malty nose with dry dark chocolate and grassy hops. Malty and chocolatey flavor with some bitter grassy hops and roastiness before a dark chocolate finish.
Black body, huge light brown head. Aroma is acidic with roasted and toasted malt and coal. Flavour is really straightforwardly acidic. Robust as promised. Balanced and strong beer.

Came out of a Smuttynose sampler pack. Deep black pour with ruby hue, smell of coffee, caramel, and nuts. Flavor was roasted coffee bean, sweet caramel, and just hit of nuts. A tad bit of bitterness at the end to round it out. A really nice porter.

This porter had a great, deep brown body with a caramel-colored head. Aromas were light of caramel and butterscotch, a little bit like peanut butter altogether. The mouth-feel was creamy and had a rich chocolate flavor. Undertones of roasted malts and oats created a perfect balance of sweet and bitter while satisfying the palate. The finish was earthy and dry like it should be, only with a chocolate pretzel aftertaste. Great!

Super smooth and easy drinking stout.  Slightly watery but that might be the Lower alcohol content.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

It has a coffee aroma and malts, which gives just the right amount of mouthfeel. There is a hint of vanilla in the taste, with a fairly good and lasting after taste. Great stuff overall. Happy to be the thousandth review for it.
Bottle.  Very dark maroon color, medium head.  Aroma of toast, plums, raisins, espresso.  Taste is chocolate, coffee, dates, dark fruit.  Very nice.

355 ml bottle.
Rated on 20110325.
Pours black color with medium head. Aroma of dark roasted malts, dry and ashy chocolate and some vanilla notes. Flavor has also lots of ashy chocolate, roasted malts and some mild ripe fruits. Could easily be mistaken as an imperial stout. Excellent.
4437

Color is a deep dark black with just a hint of dark mahogany brown highlights around the edges. Smell is a fantastic blend of dark malts, burnt raisins, bitter coffee, and a hint of floral chocolate. Taste is rightfully dark. A bit of charred wood, more dark chocolate, and dark fruits.
36cl, American brew, from Brouwerij de Molen Bodegraven, complex Porter, malty/roasted and slightly fruity/bitter, balanced, clear, good head, very good brew
16 oz draft pours a dark brown color with an off white head.  Aromas of roasted malt, chocolate, coffee.  Very smooth, very drinkable.
Coffee, roast, and sweet malt aroma and flavour.  Black/dark brown with dark brown head, lasting lacing.  Balanced, smooth, with mild bitterness.
Bottle:  Great porter.  Pours very dark with a great malty aroma and taste.

Bottle shared at a tasting at Ariels place. Pours black with a medium beige head, aroma of hops, wood, some coffee and molasses, flavor is bitter with some wood, coffee, bitter chocolate, malty sourness, medium bodied, very nice
Yum - a very nice porter here. Creamy, very well-roasted, with an appropriate bitterness. One of the best porters Ive had. Smuttynose knows what theyre doing.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Ariels place. Thanks zvikar. Dark brown with a beige to light brown head. Slightly acidic malt aroma with decent roastiness/ Roasty and rather bitter flavor with light sweetness and touches of acidity. Medium-bodied. Not bad,
Appears opaque black. Long lasting head; cardboard brown. Dry dusty aroma, nutty. Very roasted malts, lovely. Burnt malts, the bottom of a burnt cookie. Milky feel, but dry finish.

Nearly pitch black body with a thick brown head.  Deep, inviting aroma of coffee, cocoa, and malt.  Very smooth, silky palate.  The flavor matches the aroma.  Deep and complex.  Sweet malt and cocoa up front transitions nicely to a slightly bitter coffee finish.  This brew is as easy to drink as a glass of milk, and it is delicious!

Easily one one of my favorite everyday porters. Rich, malty character with a nice roast to it. The flavor is nutty, with, again, a nice roast character. Its a good meaty beer to put alongside steak. The mouthfeel is not overly thick, but lingers a little in the mouth. Overall, again, one of my favorite go-tos for porters.

12oz bottle poured into a pint glass

a: dark brown, almost black, with ruby edges. 1/4" off white head with excellent retention. light lacing

s: typical porter: coffee, chocolate

t: nice roasted/burnt malt. slightly smokey. Well balanced, no hop flavor noticable

m&d: light to medium bodied, silkey smooth mought, well carbonated.

Pours pitch black with a small toffee colored head. Aroma is pure and simply malt, coffee and chocolate. Taste is malty, sweet with chocolate and coffee, with a breakthrough of hops and bitterness. Finish is dry and somewhat bitter. Nice drinkable porter. Quaff Score 7 / 10
Pours black with a brown head and aroma of roasted malt and chocolate. Taste is of roasted malt, chocolate, and coffee with hints of hops while sweet throughout. A fine porter from Smuttynose.

Bottle: Classic porter with ultra dark color and a tan head.  Coffee burnt malt aroma.  Strong flavors of charcoal, coffee with a full body. The finish wasnt as slick as some porters which I kinda prefer.
Nice and smokey... a bit more effervercence than I prefer, but a very palatable dring indeed.

Dark brown/black color; Medium creamy body; Aroma of sweet malt, coffee, & toffee; Flavor of roasted malt, caramel, coffee, chocolate, and some dark fruit; Finish is slightly bitter; Nicely balanced & complex; Excellent porter.
Great looking beer. Black with small mocha head. Aroma is rich chocolate, citrus, burnt malt. Finishes with a sugary mouthfell and a resinous bitterness. Palate is full almost oily. Very tasty.

(bottle).  Heavily roasted malt aroma with coffee grounds.  Perfect dark brown appearance with thick long-lasting tan head.  Rich flavor of well roasted malts and slightly bitter.   Robust is the proper name; not for the faint hearted. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dry chocolate aroma with a hint of coffee. Black with a tan head thats a bit on the slim side but that could be due to a bad pour.The dark chocolate/coffee taste comes right at you but then fades to a cleaner finish. Finish has a faint dry chalk feel. Lots of carbonation for a Porter.  Very good overall.
Pours dark brown with a big, tan head. Roasted malt aroma, then a balance of sweet chocolate and bitter coffee notes. Not too thick, well balanced and tasty.

Draught pours deep brown into a pint glass, with light tan head.  Aromas are chocolate and roasted malt.  Taste is roasty malt, coffee, and chocolate.  Overall, this is a great porter that is not too heavy in body.

bottle from Bierkompass!!!

The beer in the glass is deep black, the head appears dark brown and durable. It smells strongly of roasted coffee and chocolate, very malty. Starts with bitter coffee, chocolate and roasted malt with a massive malt body!. The middle part also shows lots of roasted coffee, slightly chocolaty-sweet and bitter. Goes into a malty bitter finish with lots of chocolate, roasted malts and a subtle hint of hops!

Crisp and big bodied, very malty and nearly pitch black in color.  The chocolate and coffee flavors were nice.  My favorite part of this drink was the fresh palate delivery.  It was a heavy beer, but it didnt come off as too thick  while I let it sink into my tastebuds.  This is the best Ive tried so far from Smuttynose.

Bottle:
Another beer of this brewery with such a nice label. Still not sure whats awaiting me in that bottle.
Hmmm... An almost black pour with a nice black beer in the glass and a medium light tan/light brown head between vast and airy.
The smell is already incredible: roasted malts (almost as deep and complex as many imperial stouts), hint of burned rubber some fresh liquorice soaked hops, coffee.
The taste is incredibly strong and full of flavour, especially for such a low alcohol beer.
Nice roasted/burned malts and barleys, roasted coffee, burned wood, good bitter, coal, some fresh grass, hint of hops, some dark dried and smoked dark fruits and grains/herbs.
Damn this is strong and full of taste.
The bitterness grows and seems to get stronger towards the aftertaste.
The afteraste doesnt stay really long and isnt extremely present, but its still really good and full of roasted stuff, dried hops and good bitter.
Low carbo, soft and light spicy mouthfeel, full body and a texture between watery and creamy.
A very well executed Porter! Theres nothing here which I think anyone will dislike about this entire brew and its appearance (label, pour, beer in glass).
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: 12oz pour from bottle into pint glass. Light cocoa and coffee up front with a lasting coffee finish. Was a little disappointed due to the hype, but overall an above average porter Id recommend to someone looking for a little more of a kick.
Dark malts, grains and fruit in aroma.  The flavor is malty and leans towards coffee in the middle and chocolate in the finish.  Good maltiness and a very solid porter, easy to drink.

12oz bottle at Brouhaha, dark black color, with a big pillowy, bubbly tan head, earthy cocoa bean,  light nestlé quick powder, chocolate icecream nose, with a semi-sweet dark chocolate bar, brownie, light fruitcake note, with some coffee, chocolate milk accents in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with nice smooth, mellowness, semi-sweet dark chocolate bar, chocolate icecream, mild black coffee, burnt brownie character, with some soft roasted, chocolate, black, toasted malt, espresso, vanilla flavors, with a chocolate cake, chocolate pudding, cocoa powder, light molasses backbone, leading towards a cocoa, dark chocolate, fuggy, black coffee, cappuccino, chocolate icecream, roasty bitterness finish. A great beer!

Bottle.  Pours black with virtually zero head.  Smells are roasted malt and chocolate.. minor coffee notes.  Taste is lightly bitter and moderately sweet.  The finish is smooth and reinforces the chocolate taste.  Overall, a solid porter.. better than most.

Aroma of roast coffee, malts, and delicious dark chocolate.  Pours black with good lacing.  Tastes amazing of roasted malt, slight coffee and chocolate aftertaste.  Good and roasty.  One of the best porters out there.

Poured from a 12 oz bottle into a snifter.  Awesome coffee aroma.  Dry and crisp.  Good mouthfeel, very light with just the right amount of carbonation.  Taste is of cherries, coffee, wood, vanilla and other toasty goodness.  Not sure why this is a robust porter, but it is a very good porter.  Good show.
Aroma is chocolate and roasted malt.  Some coffee can be spotted in there as well.  Some mild hop spice in the finish.  Mild carbonation.  Full bodied.  Smooth texture.

I hadnt heard of this one until today, and am very glad to have tried this.  12 oz bottle pours a very dark brown with lingering head and quite a bit of lacing.  Looks, smells, and tastes like a well-crafted Amercan porter.  Lots of coffee and chocolate, and a full body as expected. Slightly sweet taste witghout any bitter finish, and just slightly spicy in the back of the throat.  Theres nothing outrageous or terribly complex about this one, but absolutely no complaints from me either.  Ill try another one now!

Dark cola color with a full brown head and full lacing.  Strong taste of toasted caramel malt with overtones of black coffee bitterness.  Very little change in flavor theough the finish.  Typical of US porters, but very well done, none-the-less.

12oz bottle from Binnys in Naperville.  Pours black with an impossibly long-lived head that starts dark tan and slowly fades to cream-colored as it collapses, leaving windowpane lacing in the glass.  Aroma is surprisingly faint, reminding me of a milk stout with a little sweet cream/lactose in the nose bouncing around with cocoa notes.  Flavor is nearly Baltic in strength, with burnt coffee and rich dark chocolate.  Moderate body with a lightly fruity hop finish.

Bottled 355ml. Courtesy of jaghana. Coffee, vanilla, wonderful hops which are high on alpha acids, cress, mocha, basil and sage showing up in the nose- deeply inviting. Good bitterness. Extremely smooth. I love the vanilla components. Low carbonation. Medium bodied. Mushrooms sneaking in. Dry finish which is reminiscent of licorice, vanilla and grapefruit. A fantastic beer. Thanks a lot jaghana!

Bottle @ home. Deep brown/black appearance with a fairly sizable, dark brown head. Huge roasty, chocolate malty, moderate espresso, a touch burnt aroma. Somewhat piney, bitter hoppy, huge burnt, roasty chocolate malty, moderate espresso flavor. Really a big roasty malty flavor. tasty beer.
Good but always tastes a litter strange every time I have it. I need to try it once more

UPDATED: DEC 9, 2011 Pours very dark amber with practically no head that disappears within 10 seconds. Smells great with a bit of chocolate noticeable. Taste is roasty chocolate. A little thin, but very smooth with a slightly bitter aftertaste. Very good.
Bottle,Dark brown with a small head, Chocolate and coffee mix together to produce an excellent beer.Impressive  and i have a feeling that should I rate it again the score would be even higher.
A nice robust porter.  Pours a great dark color, thin tan head that dissipates quickly.  Lots or nice toasted/roasted malts, good bitterness.  Nice beer.

35cl bottle shared with friends.
Thin off white head.  Nice smooth taste.  Deep amber pour.  very nice

I love when you pour a porter and you can smell the coffee and the chocolate.  You hope that taste is the same.  For Smutty Noses Robust Porter it is.  With its dark color and rich taste, its like having a cold late night espresso instead of a beer.

A damn good porter, the opposite of that filthy bog water Yeungling bottles and sells as a porter. Black with a quickly dissipating tan head, tastes roasty and chocolatey. A little thin for a porter, but worth drinking again.

Bottle - TWM Chantilly - pours a dark brown with an off white head. Aroma is coffee, chocolate, alcohol, and malt. Taste is sweet, bitter, and smoky. Mouthfeel is a tad dry on the finish. Overall, quite good!

Poured dark brown into an English pint glass, with nice 1 inch tan head, decent lacing throughout the drink.  Low CO2, not complex, but good balance with tastes of hops with hints of roasted dark malts, coffee malts, and chocolate.  I would enjoy a little more bite (roasted flavor), but still, the brew is well done.  A porter worth trying.

Single bottle, $1.60 at Binnys. Pours deep black, initially with a big spongy head that falls in on itself in a hurry. Big coffee bean and chocolate smell, with notes of licorice as well. Nice. Taste is indeed robust. Feels at first like it should be big on alcohol, but then its just an illusion. Then I realize its another big coffee-roast malty beer, with prickly bubbles delivering a slightly American hop profile. And before I know it, its gone. Extra credit for the Jones Soda style label.

12oz bottle. Very dark red color, bubbles on side of glass. Thin beige head, good lace. Nice, creamy mouthfeel (just bordering on oily). Light chocolate aroma. Very light carbonation. Light metallic nose, mild sweet taste. Nice rich malty flavor.
Very black colour with some redness shining through. Light tanned head. Smells chocolate, roasty, cherry, fruity. Tastes coffee, choco, cherry and raisins. Full body, great carbo.
Tap to pint glass.  Pours black with a nice copper head, and great lacing.  Roasted malt flavors, and some bitter hop twinge.  Awesome porter.
12 ounce bottle purchased at total Wine Pembroke Pines, FL for $1.99 Very good!

12 oz. bottle poured into a snifter. Very dark brown to black with a brown head. Aroma of chocolate milk, roasted malt. Medium bodied, creamy carbonation, moderately hoppy and bitter throughout. Some soft flavors of sweet coffee and roasted malt with an overall woodiness. Nice porter, nice moderate ABV.

Bottle at hotel Bodegraven, shared with Dutchdrebus and Iluvatarmilan. Dark brown almost black color with some dark red coming through. Small light brown head. Smell alcohol, raisin and wood. Taste coffee, roasty, bitter, malts, chocolate. Low to medium carbonation, medium body.

Bottle- Pours a dark brown color with a good head tan head that fades slowly and has good lacing. Looks inviting. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee and bittersweet chocolate. Has an initial bittersweet nip with coffee and roasted malt. The bitterness continues through to the finish which is quite dry. Fairly Full body, smooth and creamy with excellent balance.
Robust and very enjoyable. Excellent change of pace, kick back, relax and savor.

bottle - Pours black with a lingering tan head.  The aroma is of roast coffee.  It has a full flavor with roast coffee, a touch of chocolate, and includes a full bodied texture to give it a good mouthfeel.  Very good porter.
Draught at the Rake, Southwark, Londonaugust 2011. Clear deep brown, medium beige head. Coffee and chocolate and some licorice aroma and taste.  I liked a lot :-)

Poured from a twelve oz. bottle as if it came from a tap.   A huge mocha colored head stuck around till the end.  Aroma was roasty  maltiness.   Flavor was roasted malt with more roasted malt followed by a nice hoppy bitterness.   Yum!

yum....thats about it. black with a  tan head, aroma is of chocolate roasted malts, almost extra stout like with a slight hoppiness but nothing crazy, this is the best reason to not have something made into an imperial.
(12 ounce bottle - shaker glass)  Opaque black, almost brown color.  Heavy bitterness and medium sweetness.  Oily texture and soft carbonation.  Very good porter.
pours a deep brown, almost black. light brown head. nice retention and good amount of lacing. big aromas or roasted malts...chocolate, coffee, and some light molasses. light toffee notes, faint.
Smooth mais avec beaucoup de saveurs, sans quaucune ne volent la vedette. Le malt rôti et le caramel en entrée avec une finale chocolat doux et café. Beaucoup de caractère pour une si petite bière.

Aroma - Strong roasted coffee, chocolate malt
Appearance - Very dark brown with a lacy tan creamy head.
Taste - Coffee, creamy burnt chocolate.
Palate - Very smooth, easy to drink,and smooth!
Overall - Great porter!

Appearance: pours oily, inky black with a creamy tan head and thickish lacing.  Aroma: bitter dark chocolate, bit of licorice, some wood and fresh-cut pine boughs.   Taste: bitter dark chocolate, espresso, resinous hops, a bit of lactic souness.   Finish: lingering, piney-dry bitterness and coffee roastyness.   Notes: 	Appearance and palate were like a big stout.  Nice and smooth, well-balanced between roasty and bitter.  Better and better as it warmed.  By the time I was done with it, I was nearly in love.   Sunday morning breakfast stout (porter) of the week.
Draught at the Rake, Southwark, London. Clear deep brown, medium beige head. Plain coffee and chocolate roasted aroma. Dry with medium bitterness.
Thick brown pour under a brown (!) head.  Wonderful roasted aroma, sticky palate, just a rich world of flavor.  More smut, plz!

A pitch black colored beer, with a thick foamy dark beige head. The aroma of coffee with liquorice juice, hints of chocolate and some sweet. The taste of bitter coffee, with some sweet fruits. There are notes of chocolate. The aftertaste is dry, bitter with sweet.

Poured from a 12 oz bottle.  Pours a very dark brown almost black.  Limited, quickly dissipating tan head.  A very rich flavor-filled taste, which a distinct malt and hits of chocolate and coffee.  Absolutely worth a try.

Bottle. Pours clear brown which looks black once in glass and shows a frothy kahki head that fades to a film. Aroma is burnt roasted malt with a subtle sweetness. Taste is more the same burnt roasted malt marshmellow and some earth. Palate is medium and chaulky that finishes dry. Solid!
Bottle at Beer Tempel, Amsterdam. Aklmost black with a beige head. Melasses andcaramel aroma. On the sweet side with lots of melasses flavours and hints of nuts. Lives up to its name.

Sample, Mondial de la bière, savoured on June 9 2011; eye: black, opaque, tiny ring of coffee head, light lacing; nose: roasted malt, dark chocolate, chocolate milk, light vanilla; mouth: roasted malt, dark chocolate, chocolate milk, light vanilla, acridness, light hops, finale in roasted malt with presence of acridness, full body, average carbonation, lightly bitter, lightly oily texture; overall: fine

FRANÇAIS

Échantillon, Mondial de la bière, savourée le 9 juin 2011; il : noire, opaque, petit anneau de mousse café, légère dentelle; nez : malt torréfié, chocolat noir, lait au chocolat, léger vanille; bouche : malt torréfié, chocolat noir, lait au chocolat, léger vanille, âcreté, léger houblon, finale en malt torréfié avec présence dâcreté, corsée, carbonatation moyenne, légèrement amère, texture légèrement huileuse; en résumé : bien

UPDATED: SEP 10, 2013 drank at mondial 2011 in mtl and bottle at home. pours very dark brown with a medium-dark beige frothy head, excellent retention and lacing. aroma of strong bitter coffee and chocolate. bitter and dry coffee, dark roasted malts, crema, hint of vanilla and smoke. hint of maple-smokey sweetness. medium body - oily, soft carbonation, bitter coffee finish. excellent!

(Bottled). Id like to sample this while sober sometime ; nothing too smutty about this beer,  but I recall from my almost nonsensical notes a good roasty coffee and aromatic hop showcasing. It looked very good in a tulip , giant beige head ,deep brown body , if almost like it could not be more comfortable in any other glass.  Youd drink lots of UK Porters & not find such lively floral hop accent as here.   The balance of roast flavours & hops is just right .

Pour dark brown good tan head good lace. Aroma chocolate, coffee, cocoa, heavy cream, mild hops, nutty. Taste bakers chocolate, cocoa, milk chocolate, good bittering and flavor hops, roasty, slight nuttiness, mild coffee. MF medium full body mild carb. Nice brew very tasty and easy drinking with good sweet and bitter balance and good flavor profile.

UPDATED: JUN 29, 2013 12 oz Bottle. The pour was a deep dark brown, almost black with an average (1-2 finger) frothy light brown head that reduced down to a thin puddled film, which lasted throughout and had some really excellent streaky lacing. 

The aroma was of burnt chocolate malts and a strong leathery yeast with notes of dark roasted coffee, molasses, dark bitter chocolate and a mild smokiness. 

The taste was mildly bitter-sweet and very malty with a bold chocolate note in the beginning, and then became a little more on the bitter side with a strong dose of coffee towards the finish. The flavor lasted a good long while following the swallow with a nice roasty coffee taste settling in on the taste buds. 

Mouthfeel was full in body and rather creamy yet slightly dry in texture with an mild carbonation. 

Overall I found this brew to be very Robust just as the name insinuates, and rather flavorful with a nice roasty characteristic. The mocha espresso taste made it very drinkable and quite enjoyable to sip on. This is a beer that most definitely does justice to the style... 
www.facebook.com/KAJIIsBeerReviews

Neutral aroma, somewhat sweet, but not particularly rich or malty. No hop aroma. The look in the glass is beautiful - pitch black with a creamy off-white head. Very pretty. Initial impression is of full and creamy mouthfeel - stout-like and very nice. The flavor is first sweet and not particularly complex,. malty, or roasty. No hop flavor. The finish is slightly harsh and burnt-tasting. My guess is that they used a pinch too much black malt and a pinch too little chocolate malt... the balance is off somehow. Still, is is a pretty nice beer, despite the somewhat straighforward flavor and the detracting finish.
Pours deep black with mocha head .  Aroma is dark chocolate and roastyness.  Taste is earthy, roasty bitters.  Very smooth mouthfeel.

Pours a thick, creamy, lacing tan head with a deep brown body.  Aroma of roasted malt and a coffee note.  Flavors of roasted malt, some coffee, hint of anise.  Finish has a lasting bitterness and a short dry spell.

Bottle. Well retained tan head. Pine hop aroma, coffee, mocha, chocolate and caramel malts. Med body, med carbonation, creamy mouthfeel - balanced malt complexity with hop flavour and bitterness. Semi-Sweet balanced finish, very satisfying. Roast and mocha lingering through.

Verre de dégustation, dune bouteille, au Mondial 2011. Arômes présentant de belles notes de torréfaction (chocolat noir, café) et de fruits mûrs. Robe brune très foncée aux reflets roux, limpide, petite mousse moka et effervescence moyenne. En bouche, la bière présente une belle complexité maltée (cacao, café) et une belle texture moelleuse, sans être sucrée. Finale montrant une belle sécheresse de cacao et une pointe de houblon résineux. Tout à fait dans le style et très agréable.

Sample at Mondial de la Bière (Montréal). Opaque dark brown body with a lasting beige foamy head. Rich malty/hoppy aroma with oaky and chocolate hints. Its very well balanced taste carries plummy, woody, and chocolate notes. Ends with a long, strong bittersweet finish. Excellent Porter.

Pours dark black with about a half a finger of beige head.  Nose of chocolate and cane sugar.  Taste has alcohol on the frong, with chocolate and malt notes fading away to a burnt toast aftertaste.  Good mouthfeel, good porter.

A bit underwhelmed here. Pours black with a thin brown head from bottle. Some chocolate notes on the nose. The taste is a bit muted for my palate. Some roasted chocolately notes and it finishes fairly dry.

08-APR-2011, bottle @Sonni, @Ulkløbben tasting, from "Fish & Beer".
Almost black with beige head.
Weak nose.
Roasted but more sweet coffee, almost coco.
Really nice creamy stuff but lacks something in roastiness and creaminess.
Tasted side by side with Founders and Founders comes out better.

Röstiger und süßer Malzantrunk mit einem Toffeetouch. Röstiger wird es im Mittelteil, Kaffeenoten kommen hinzu, die Süße steigt leicht. Dazu etwas herb und trocken. Dezent nach Pflaume. Vollmundiges Porter. 8/9/9/9/5/9

Bottle.  Pours a super dark brown/black with little head that leaves a wee bit of lace throughout.   Aroma is a toasty, roasty malt goodness with just a splash of sweetness.  Tastes of "robust" and roasted choco/coffeeliciousness.  Really just a fantastic beer, however you want to classify it.  Finishes nicely with the bitterness of the toasted dark malt and then a bit of sweetness lingers on my flavor-saver-stach.  Just a good, Wednesday late-night type of chillin beer.

12oz bottle.  Pours a dark brown color with a thin tan head and some lacing.  Aroma is roasty, coffee, chocolate.  Medium on the palate with average carbonation.  Flavor is bitter, coffee, roasted malt, with a nice bitter coffee finish.  An excellent porter.
Tried this beer at the Casanova Beer Cave Festival (2011), had a very nice roasty flavor.
Enjoyed this one, but maybe less than the average rating. Good smoky dark malt start, then some metallic taste, maybe even like a Pepsi.

A - Pours a dark black-brown color with a finger of off white head atop. The head fades down to a ring around the glass leaving behind some really nice lacing.

S - Aroma is full of roasted caramel malts with coffee and chocolate mixed in. Touch f smokiness and milk also noticeable.

T - Starts off with a hit of roasted flavors with some malt and coffee flavors. There is some coffee and a touch of lactate in the background. Through the middle, some stronger roasted flavor comes in with some burnt malt and a hint of smoke. The finish is a mix of deep roasted malt and coffee with some bitter chocolate flavor mixed in that lingers really nicely.

M - Medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Feels a bit creamy and really smooth. Really full roasted feel at the finish.

D - Very drinkable. Flavors are really nicely balanced and mix together. The roasted flavor is really nice throughout. Finish is full of flavor and really nice.

[bottle]
Burnt almond, vanilla, black pepper, and slightly smoky aroma. Opaque black under a red-tan cover that is thin and lacy and with large bubbles. Fudge brownie flavour that is smoky and wih some vanilla and bourbon. Medium body, medium carbonation, medium bitterness from black malt hangs on a bit in the finish.

Picked this bottle up at Vintage Estate in Ohio. Served in a Hill Farmstead wine glass.

Pours nearly black with a thin light mocha head that disappears pretty quickly and leaves just a bit of a thin collar. There are a few bubbles on top as well. The nose brings some very nice dark chocolate along with a bit of roast. Chocolate is quite nice and hits well. The roast lingers in the background, but adds some complexity. 

The flavor hits pretty hard and offers up quite a bit of goodness. The chocolate and roast blend beautifully along with some lingering dryness and bitterness. Light amounts of espresso and molasses in the finish. Quite nice and doesnt really present any alcohol. There is a lingering bit of strange dryness in the long finish; almost cardboard-like, but I wouldnt call it oxidized. Medium-to-full body with moderate carbonation. Really quite nice and one of the better porters that Ive had in quite sometime.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 03-16-2011

Aroma, hints of cocoa and coffee. Taste is complex; starts with unsweetened chocolate, hints of coffee, and ends with a nice balanced hint of smokiness. All around great beer- none of the elements overpower one another.

12oz bottle. Pours a black body with a finger-width, dense and creamy, brown head that dissipates slowly and leaves a nice lacing. Aroma is sweeter roasted malts with a nice chocolate and a touch of creamy coffee. Some caramels, floral hops, and a touch of vanilla. Flavor is similar. Lots of sweet roasts and chocolates with a well balanced hop bitterness. Caramel, a light coffee, vanilla, and some pines. Finishes dry and roasty with a moderate bitterness and a few pines, but balanced with plenty of chocolate and a light caramel. Lengthy aftertaste following a very smooth, clean, medium body and moderate carbonation. Overall, a pretty excellent porter. Bold, roasty, and a solid hoppy bitterness that is all balanced nicely with plenty of chocolates and a light caramel. This was an impressive, flavorful, balanced beer.

12 fl oz bottle from BOTW (Rochester), served at cellar temperature in a tulip glass. 15AL11.
App.:  Deep brown-black with a nice mocha froth.
  
Aroma:  Quite tangy, woody, fruity, a little like a good Balsamic (!), some nice dark malt notes  chocolate, coffee, molasses, a touch of licorice, close to a big ol Stout, maybe even an Impy, but with a few signs of infection.
  
Palate:  Medium+ body, moderate effervescence,a  little powdery.
  
Flav.:  Really big, inky malts, molasses, some acidic black coffee, high-cocoa dark chocolate, a little hops, pretty nice and very reminiscent of an Impy Stout; dry with good bitterness and a nice dark chocolate and black coffee finish. 

The nose had me worried, but the beer pulled through.  Dont do that to me again, Smuttynose.

355ml bottle.  Pours a very dark brown with a tight, medium head.  Aroma is peat, tar and a little bacon.  Taste starts with peat and smoke.  Tar and peat on the finish.  Really nice beer, drinks above its strength.

Black with a medium brown head.  in the nose is grapefruit, and resinous hop character with black roated malt character and chocolate notes.  Taste is full on blend of citrus and fruity hop and roasted malts.  Light sweetness and heavy on the bitterness.  Medium body and some nice bitter roast character with nice hop bitterness to finish it off.  One of the best porters Ive had.

Bottled@ Beer Temple, Amsterdam. The aroma has roast, coffee. Black coloured beer with an off-white, medium, lasting head. The taste is light-moderate bitter, has delicate coffee, roast, some cola, some chocolate. Dry, light-medium bodied beer. Really nice.
Very delicious, and despite the name, is incredibly smooth with sweet coffee-ish malts and a pungent aroma.

Bottle 355ml at Patricks. Pours dark brown with light brown head. Aroma is chocolate, coffee, roasted, licorice. Taste is medium sweet, medium to very bitter. Full body, oily, soft carbonation. Yum! 20110317

12oz bottle into my Orval glass...Dark brown pout, light tan head rises only about a finger, light retention ok lacing...A very "robust" aroma that gives off ton of strong coffee. Its not too much, the coffee smell is just right, but it is a little plain, not much going on but a very wonderful smelling coffee...The taste is much of the same, a really nice coffee throughout not complex. Big drag is the feel, its really light, but makes for a super drinkaable porter.

Bottle. Impressive thickness for this porter. Instead of a watered-down porter with some nutty taste, this porter has a robust texture with flavors of chocolate, molasses, cloth sack and malt. Medium darkness, like a cola. Light tan head. Nice lacing down the glass. Glad I went with this selection.
Bottle from Beers of Europe. Black colour, tan head. Aroma is deep roasted malts and coffee. Flavour is deep roasted malts, coffee, hint of burnt flavours. Medium bodied.

Draft at Kumas. Pours a dense brown/black with a tan head. Nose is chocolate, roasted and black malts, light hops. On taste, very smooth. No grainy astringency, nice level of roast and cocoa. Pretty text book, if unexciting. A pretty faultless beer that shows what a porter should be. A touch high in ABV, imo, but a solid beer nonetheless.

Consumed at Leons Full Service from draft into one of those dumb British ringed pint glass. This is really dark with excellent lacing and a tan head. The aroma is ultra roasty with burned notes everywhere. It really seems like espresso. It takes just a quick sip to experience the chewiness of this beer. Some caramel comes out with lots of notes of cacao and coffee. One of the best porters ever, especially if you like em roasty.

Sampled with maniac.  Near black pour with good brown head.  Sweet and roasty nose becomes sweeter and more earthy bitter in the flavor.  The roast also has some piney hops to balance.  Chocolate bitter finish.  Good stuff though.
Pours black with a tan head.  Nice aroma, roasted malt, chocolate, coffee.  Same for the flavor - really good beer.  Wish I had bought more.
Bottle 0,35ltr: Dark brown coloured brew with an great bitter chocolate and coffee taste. Sure one of mine favorites and one of mine favorite beer labels.
Bottle. Very dark brown with small light brown head. Flavour is roasted malts, bitter, chocolate and coffee.
Poured from 12oz bottle, pours black with a tan head and spotty lacing through out the glass, aroma and flavor of chocolate and coffee, it has a nice finish of chocolate, delicious.

12oz - Mild roasted nose, good color, nice head.  Flavor was there, but it seemed too light.  Even the mouthfeel seemed too light.  This was more than a colored lager, but didnt have the depth or weight of a Porter.

Beers of Europe. This is how I like my porter. Chocoalte, coffee and roast malt aroma, lovely dryness, with blackcurrant taste. Loads of mouthfeel and just the right amount of acrid smokiness. Excellent stuff.

Sampled on draft at Cloverleaf.  Pours a very dark, nearly opaque brown with light creating reddish highlights around the sides.  A thin cola colored head remains thick and pillowy throughout the drink.  The aroma is rich with intense roastiness, espresso, and a hint of smokiness.  Flavors are also rich and similar, but the most notable element of the beer is the balance.  So creamy and delicious, I could drink the whole keg.  No one element of the beer is all that remarkable, but the syngergy of the various individual aromas, flavors, and sensations on the palate are truly wonderful.

Bottle: Literally black, smaller beige head with a little lace; solid dark-malty and leathery nose completed by a good dash of cacao and sweet fruits; drier bitter-sweet flavour, almost full bodied; slightly lingering fruity (berries) and leathery finish with a bitter (caused by roasted malt) aftertaste. The right stuff....

12 oz bottle. Pours midnight black with a nice and thick tan head. Beautiful roasted aroma that has some slight bitter cocoa coming through. Nice medium to full body mouth feel perfectly balanced between a porter that is too light or something too thick and chewy that its more of a stout. Great roasted flavors balanced with slight bitter cocoa and coffee notes. Finished slightly dry and bitter with a slight hop finish. Very nice well balanced robust porter. This is something you can have a few of, well done! Overall: (A-)

Pours black with a decent light-brown head. Nice smoky aroma. Flavor is Smoky Roasted Malt! Appearance is nice with a lot of lacing. While not as thick & heavy as a Stout, it is closer to a stout than a porter. It seems a little hop on the finish, nice balance. Very good Porter. Smuttynose is really starting to impress me.

355 ml bottle. From bierkompass.de.
Black colour with tiny light tan head.
Aroma is fruity, caramel, sweet sugar, chocolate, mild roasted malt and still some interesting twist. Roasted malt, bitter hops, coffee and some ashiness in flavour. Bitterness stays. Proper Porter.

12oz bottle. Pours a dark brown with a medium light tan head and streaks of lacing. Aroma is coffee, hops and a touch of chocolate. Rich body with a well-balanced array of flavours from bitter coffee and hops to roasted malt and chocolate. The finish is dry with roasted coffee and lingering hops. Very good.
another one of those overtly hoppy porters that american brewers feel the need to make which at least to me personally throws off the balance. ill take the Bells Porter over this any day.

UPDATED: MAR 2, 2011 Botella en casa. Pitch black colour (thick density), dark brown hue, with a nice huge creamy light brown head, diminishing though good lacing. Pleasant heavy aroma of roasted malt and caramel, chocolate and coffee. Full palate, creamy and alcoholic (in a good way), average carbonation. The flavour is quite pleasant with a heavy roasted maltiness, chocolate, some coffee, liqourice, good bitterness, bit dark fruitiness. Well lasting finish: Heavy roasted malt, chocolate and coffee with a good not too strong bitterness. Tasty brew indeed!
Easy drinker porter, roasted malts, balanced hops, not overly complex. Good every dayer.

(bottle, 35.5cl) Black colour with a beige and short foamy head. Roasted malty aroma with notes of coffee and leather on a mildly fruity hoppy background. Moderately bitter flavour, medium bodied with a soft carbonation. Robust roasty malty taste with notes of leather and mocha, combined with a dry mouthfeel; bitter-sweet roast-malty finish with leather and a fruity hoppy tail. Pleasantly Stout-like Porter. 16.II.11
Nose is pepper, bittersweet malt, gingerbread, feel is broad, carb is low, taste is alcohol, burnt malt, heavy chocolate, bark

Pours dark brown with a light brown head. Aroma is roasted malt, light citrus hop. coffee, light liquorish, light chocolate and light toffee. Flavour is roasted malt, chocolate, coffee and light citrus hop.

Bottle. Dark brown, small to average and fully diminishing light brown head. Moderate malty and lightly sweetish aroma, roasted malt, coffee and licorice with some hoppyness. Body is medium, malty and lightly sweetish flavor, coffee and roasted malt, light hoppyness. Finish is average, malty and lightly sweetish, some roasted malt and coffee, light hoppyness. More coffee than hoppyness.

Bottle from de molen. Aroma is malty coffee with some spices.
Flavour is thin yet full malty caramel coffee/mocca goodness. Very full and rich for the abv. Good stuff.

Very dark brown, almost black color with almost no head.  There is a roasted coffee aroma.  The taste is bitter with a clean finish.  I can taste some creamy malty notes.  The aftertaste is not that strong.  Pretty nice porter.
Smuttynose Robust Porter on musta olut ja omaa ruskean vaahdon. Tuoksussa on paljon suklaata ja paahtunutta mallasta. Maku on suklainen, lakritsinen, paahtunut ja aavistuksen tuhkainen. Aika robusti!

355 ml bottle.
Pours a black colour with a small white beige head. Aroma of chocolate malts and some coffee. Flavour of pleasant roasted malts, coffee and some hops too. Medium bodied with a smooth mouthfeel. Dry coffee-driven finish. Good.

330ml bottle from Bierkompass

Pours black with a nice brown head. Aroma and taste have hints of roasted coffee. Nicely balanced porter.

UPDATED: JUN 21, 2014 Pours dark with a deep brown head. Aroma of smoked malts, choclate, roasted coffee and liquorice. Taste add a hoppy profile which gives it some bitterness at the end along with some bitter chocolate. Excellent balanced and a suitable body.

Bottle. Motor oil brown with similar viscosity, and a dense lighter brwon head that shows great retention. Hard roasted aroma, bitter chocolate, slightly brothy, hoppy undertones. Richly flavoured with bitter dark roast, chocolate, light coffee, light leather, medium hoppy bitter finish. This drinks far bigger than its ABV. An outstanding porter.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Draft. Tastes of coffee, chocolate, malt with hops. Very good and omplex. Like it a lot
Black pour with thick, creamy, tan head. Strong aroma of coffee, chocolate, and burnt malt. Good lacing. Thick mouthfeel. Flavor is same as aroma. Classic stout porter. Very satisfying.

UPDATED: FEB 11, 2011 Bottle via trade with Illini08, thank you! creamy chocolate nose off this brown beer. The head is nice creamy chocolate milk hued.  Nice clean roasty chocolaty and nicely balanced hoppy flavors...everything combined nicely and I enjoyed this porter a lot more than I enjoy most low gravity porters.

Bottled at Henrik, Bergen. Best before 02/11.Pours deep brown almost black with an inch thick dark tanned head.Aroma of dark malts, chocolate and coffee. Good and inviting aroma, promising. I was not let down , the taste is what the aroma suggest, moderate sweet dark chocolate, roasted malts a hint of smoke and liquorice. Smooth mouthfeel. Halleluja.

Pours a dark brown with a creamy tan head that leaves lace on the way down. Smells of chocolate and licorice. Tastes of chocolate, malty, roasty in the finish. Great roasty chocolaty flavor. Mouthfeel is creamy and silky smooth. moderate carbonation. Medium body. This is a fantastic porter, one of my favorites. At 5 % its easy to have a couple.

Bottled. Dark color, medium brown head. Aroma of soft coffee, roasted malt, hint of sugar, dark chocolat, hint of vanilla, hint of blackcurrant, slight fruity hop. Lovely strong taste of roasted malt and chocolat, fruity notes as well. Finish of dry coffee, some bitterness.

UPDATED: APR 20, 2011 On draft @ Barley Pub in Dover,NH. Very dark brown, almost black body with a small, white head. Aroma is strong dark chocolate, malt, coffee and fruity hops. Very promising aroma, and the flavor deliver as expected as well. Dominating, rich chocolate flavor with moderate roasted malt, coffee and hops. Well-made, delicious and tasty, awesome on draft!
I4/ 20/ 2011 had on draft again and realized that this is one of the better porters I have tasted.  Had to adjust my rating.
Bottle. Creamy off-white good mostly lasting head. Black colour. Heavy malty and moderate hoppy aroma. Heavy bitter cery nice flavor. Bitterroasted notes. Long nice finish. Creamy palate. Good stuff.
Bottled from Bierkompass. Almost black color with almost no head. Aroma, rum raisins, dark chocolate. Taste, raisins, some spices, dark chocolate, dry coffee finish. Nice beer.

Draft at Redlight Redlight. This one pours a very dark mahogany brown, nearly black in color and topped by a small, smooth tan colored of foam that settles quickly to a thin film. The foam leaves patches of lacing around the glass. The aroma is really nice and roasty showing dry, dark cocoa, roasted barley, toasted caramel, and some earthen hop bitterness. The flavor follows suit with the dry, dark cocoa and toasted caramel up front followed by roasted coffee and earthy hop bitterness on the back end. Medium bodied with active carbonation that leads to a dry, roasted finish. This is a solid, roasty porter.
Bottle @ Ørsted bar. Nice creamy head with good duration. Color is black. Aroma and taste are chocolate, coffee, roast malt and hops.
12 oz. bottle in a snifter.  Nice dark rich chocolaty pour with minimal head.  Strong smoky aroma.  Oak and chocolate flavors with a rich malty finish.  Excellent porter.

Bottle, bought @ Ølbutikken, Cph.
Pours dark brown to black with a lovely, staying, creamy, light-brown head. Aroma is lovely roasted, dark chocolate, mild cocoa-powder, light blackberries. Good creaminess in aroma. Lowish to medium carbonation, fine creamy mouthfeel. Flavour has fresh malts, good cocoa, dark chocolate and mild coffee. Long, lingering malty bitterness. Nice.

Flaske: Brunsort klar øl med et lille skumhoved. Dejlig duft af kaffe, sød malt og humle. Lige som en london porter skal være. Smagen lever fuldstændig op til duften hvor humlen giver et fint modspil til den let brændte sødlige malt. Super øl.

12oz bottle in a shaker.  Pours very dark brown with a thick, lacy, tan head.  Aroma of chocolate, hops, roasted dark malts.  Flavor a really nice balance of thick chocolate and roasted malts and light pine hops.  Could be thicker.  A pretty good porter.

12 oz bottle. Pours a dark brown, almost black with a dark tan head. Big taste of roasty mocha and bitter chocolate. An almost full body brew that leaves a nice stick and has a dark dried fruit- chocolate covered raisins- taste that lingers behind the big hops. Delicious.
